vtmjNERuHj9XQUAGsrubqA.text: Best Vegetarian Vietnamese option in town. I can honestly say I have never been able to enjoy Spring Rolls because typically I have found that they have pork and shrimp in them. Not only does Viet Noodle offer Vegetarian Spring Rolls but they are absolutely delicious. Warm and freshly made to order perfect ratio every bite is like a salad.... That you must dip into the peanut sauce!!!! They have a few other items on their veggie friendly menu I have tried but I always opt for the Springs Rolls and Pho. My only wish is that they would brighten up the veggie selection in their pho.... I have come back time and time again hoping it would change or become more authentic but we aren't there yet. It's okay the SR's keep me coming back!   To top off that note I have also eaten here with meat eaters and they have enjoyed the food! So all in all I can say this place satisfies everyone's taste preference.....

BcAD2GYhPpFIK3ZYGjerOw.text: Not too far from the strip and they're open 24hrs a day! Sayyyy what??!! That's right, I had the combo pho which came up to be $10 but it was worth it even for a small had plentiful noodles and a large handful of meats and veggies. The pho flavor was exactly what it should be, had tons flavor, we also ordered the calamari which reminded me on onion ring, nice crunchy outside and fresh meaty inside. Worth the order. Egg rolls come out on a plate with lettuce which I'm gonna assume the locals eat along with the egg rolls because they're super meaty. I def would go back, spent less then $30 on a table for 2 compared to spending $30 on one person on the strip. I would recommend this place to everyone, they deserve the great review, food was good, wish I had taken pictures!.

0cFBoaqU4SKf978aEfyLsA.text: Went to Viet Noodle Bar after a recommendation from a local.  We drove about 15-20 minutes from the strip and we found it easily in Chinatown.  Parking was packed at around 9pm.    We went in, and the place was packed.  We had to wait about 10 minutes for a table.  The smell from inside smelled so good, like Korean BBQ.  I ordered Banh Canh Tom (Shrimp Udon Noodle).  The broth was a bit bland and it only came with 3 pieces of small shrimps.  It also came with the usual veggies that come with Pho.  The food itself was okay.  My favorite was probably the egg roll with the lettuce and daikon/carrot mix.   I must've ordered the wrong item. I looked at other tables and looked like they were cooking things like Korean BBQ style... that must be their popular item.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our delicious meal at Viet Noodle Bar

xChOpk7tYQa6NYK_kpI3MA.text: Fast service  Good food Kind owner  Its not 5 star because sometimes spring rolls dont feel fresh and pho soup smell but its not bad

tudACOWLD02Q6IkI_Y5dTw.text: This may just be the new spot!   My friend and I was looking for a place to get her pho fix as our usual spot Pho So 1, was closed. We decided to try this place out.   The wait time was short and we were seated promptly. The menu was easy to read and we found what we wanted quite easily. We both noticed that they have more than one type of egg roll(vegetable, pork, shrimp) which was nice as other restaurants have the selection of just egg or spring roll. Their pho no matter the type comes in Small or Large and that was new to us as well as other restaurants just offer one size.   I opted for a large combination pho and my friend had the same in a size small and we also ordered pork egg rolls. I loved that they brought out our own separate plate full of the toppings; bean sprouts, mint and jalapenos. Not that it's a problem to share but it's nice having our own to take from. The flavor in the egg rolls and pho were very delicious. I actually should've gotten a small as the large was too much for just myself but my friend ate all hers.   We'll definitely come back here when we're craving more pho!

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Special combination pho
Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork and vegetable egg rolls

USh_X9hcwW1vK2NjujfE5w.text: This is one of the top pho places in town! I've been coming here since it was under a different name and management a few years ago and it was good even then. Upon returning and noticing it was named something else and new staff, I was a bit hesitant thinking the standards and my hopes wouldn't be met let alone exceeded. However, it's even better!  I usually get the small combination pho for under $9 and, trust me, it's delicious and more than enough.  They meat is proportional to the bowl size and the broth on it's own (w/o adding anything) is tasty and is not sweet like I've tried at other pho joints, and the noodles are cooked right.  I have also tried their chicken wings and they are so good! So don't be afraid to explore. You'll be pleasantly surprised.   Beware: you must spend at least $15 to use your credit/debit card.    Service is great and speedy. The place is beautiful and clean. Plenty of space.   This is my favorite pho place to go and don't mind making the drive to Chinatown for it.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combination pho.  Beautiful
Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JmH8zahvjpAp0OAhm8CwLQ.text: Came in with a party of 12, called ahead to let them know we were coming. Once we arrived we were seated immediately!  We were given the menu and was not rushed to give our orders.   A lot of us ordered pho of course, from combo to selecting our own choices of meat etc. --the broth was good, they give you enough meat, tendon etc for you to eat the entire bowl with the noodles. That is always a plus. Also, when taking our order, we were asked if we'd like the cilantro and onions or not. That was nice.  Also ordered appetizers-- spring roll & egg roll (4 decent sized) comes with of course the lettuce, mint, cucumber, thinly sliced pickled carrots and radish w/ dipping sauce.   In addition to that, some of us also got the vermicelli with egg roll and pork, and the sugar cane shrimp with egg roll- they seemed to enjoy it since the entire bowl was eaten.  Also got the Che Ba Mau- Tri colored dessert- perfect to top off dinner. Not too sweet, mix everything and give it a bite. Tasty.   Let me tell you about service, Hoang (forgive me for spelling if incorrect) was our server. He's very delightful, patient and knows how to provide over the top customer service. His smile is contagious and we will come back to see him again! He's very respectful and that's what will keep us coming back.   I need to remember to take pictures of my food but I'm sure you'll be able to find pictures of what we ordered posted here already!

T1d4ScsmZqYCEz-8r9LeFg.text: I have to say I was not impressed with the service. We got seated fast, but it took forever for the waiter to come over and ask what we wanted to drink. After he came back with our drinks he left and didn't ask if we were ready to order. Then after the constant stare of looking over at the waiters one finally came over and took our order. We ordered the pho and it tasted okay. I wish it had more flavor to it. Waiting 15 mins for a waiter to come back to us and eating the food. I say that it was not worth coming back. Maybe in the future it will be better. I hope.

XrvvpFS6BP6MUPNCCq7rEQ.text: This place never disappoints! My co workers and I visit this place often after work and at 4am what's better than pho? At that hour there's never a wait to be seated, and our food comes considerably fast every time. The restaurant is open until 6am, but the kitchen does close at 5:30. This my fourth time here and I have left satisfied every single time. Today I ordered the ox tail pho, egg rolls, and spring rolls with charbroiled pork.  The ox tail pho only comes in one size, a large, and it's huge! I wish there was an option to order a small because I am never able to finish it all.   The egg rolls are served extremely hot each time. They come in an order of 4. They're fresh, and exceptionally crispy. Wrap with the accompanied veggies and dip them in fish sauce! Yummm!  The spring rolls are good. They too come 4 to an order. They are light, and the pork is full of flavor.

Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg rolls

t4WRqyyAVserl9mpIYJwew.text: Excellent food. Restaurant looks sexy on a  day time too. We felt so International. Great Service, located in china town, heart of las vegas. I have never enjoyed a cuisine as much as this vietnamese food for a very long time. Wish they had deserts as wel. But not to be. Will come back again to try some other dishes.

09kd1VRfqtJoAEltCryyOw.text: BEST PHO IN TOWN. I was recommended and I absolutely love this place! Waiters will answer any questions you have! And me not knowing anything, I reallly do appreciate it!  P.S do not come here on a Sunday afternoon. Super busy. Slow service. We waited 30+ for our check and to go container

Cbc5xnEgWFKedglv-ERddg.text: Everytime we stay in vegas this is our go to spot for pho! It never never disappoints.  Been to every single pho place with high ratings on yelp but for me this is the best place for vietnamese cuisine closest to the strip albeit situated in Chinatown.  I have honestly been coming every day since day one of our trip (but trying different stuff) and everything Ive ordered is bomb asf! Combination pho (Monday) Oxtail pho (Tuesday) and Bun Bo hue (Wednesday). Today is flipping Thursday! Lmaooo.   I got more shiracha running through my veins than blood! ;)  It is well worth it tho! VNB i salut you!

Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wraps u dip in water to make soft to wrap the condiments

nEESEMuODVoTJ42GFO0h0w.text: Amazing how this place is almost open 24/7. We stopped in around 3am after a party and there were a few people there. The restaurant was huge - plenty of seats to choose from. There was cute decor inside, there was a classic but modern vibe.  We ordered a combination pho each per person - I thought the portion size was huge and it wasn't expensive. They gave a good amount of meat and noodles. The broth was decent, not too bad. We also ordered shrimp spring rolls but after we almost finished our pho, it never showed up. We asked our waiter and it looked like the kitchen had forgotten about it until later on so we asked to just cancel the order. Towards the end, they brought us the shrimp spring rolls anyways (for free, on the house) because said that the kitchen was already working on it by the time we realized. That was really nice of them, they didn't have to because we weren't upset - so full from the pho already.   The service was pretty good besides the forgotten order - they filled up our water very often and checked up on us.

aF7d8ljOqV0lH7TG5p9kjQ.text: If you are in the mood for some awesome Vietnamese food to cure a hangover, do come here.  The second I pulled the doors open and got that first sniff of the deliciousness exuding from inside the restaurant, I just knew I wasn't going to be disappointed!   I ordered bun bo hue and it was so delicious. At first I wasn't sure if I was going to be able to stomach all the seasonings, spices and herbs that was in the soup but it held down and it surely cured my hangover. Definitely will be coming back here before we leave town.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combination fried rice.
Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bun bo hue. Best cure for a hangover.

xG7AAPWw26YKJuB6lq6V5w.text: The flavors are good. The service is okay. Relatively clean and there are no flies flying around like a lot of the other Vietnamese places. Located in a strip mall across from Southwest Gas. Pretty good size menu and carries a variety of your standard Vietnamese fare. It's always full but there is still room to get around and I like that the tables and chairs are not squeezed together where you find it difficult to get up. Sometimes it's a little hard to get someones attention and you kind of feel ignored a lot. I know it might seem rude to say that I don't expect much out of Asian service, but I don't. The service here is typical of most Asian restaurants. I come here for the food and it's always pretty good. The parking is easy. The prices are reasonable.

vJGQk5Eo-hc4IeIT5Izr2A.text: I've never really ate at places away from the strip before! My relatives drove us to this Vietnamese restaurant for breakfast one morning. It's spacious, good for large parties. We had a party of 11 and there was more than enough space for other large parties. The service was great and food did not take long to come out.   We ordered many dishes and none of us were disappointed. Nothing was bland, everything was seasoned really well! I would love to come back here for more Vietnamese food!

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Y_HJhkrVNb3_uxlSnP5PwA.text: Ordered the pho tai $9 for a small bowl and bun bo hue $11. Both were pretty good but I definitely have to say the bun bo hue was fantastic! Generous portion, variety of meats, full plate of assorted veggies, and flavorful broth. This definitely hit the spot after a night out around the town!   Good food, quick service.  Cheers

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banh Xeo $11.95 it is sooo big!!
Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pH98ud_IN7uRe4gAiTfe4w.text: Our spot for Vietnamese food when we come in town.. Beef pho is always on point. Almost everything is tasty. Thai tea reminds me of our own recipe, so good!!

RGxLHz2TIwZCvyR6DuAyPw.text: When it comes to Pho restaurants I have three fave spots and this includes Viet Noodle bar. This place has fast service, clean area and accommodating staffs.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Zi9MP-TIBrJEXySYO4BAJg.text: The food was amazing, service was alright. Tight spot if you want to bring a bigger party. But over rall, we waiting no longer than 15 mins to be seated.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #30. Bun with 1 Item
Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6usE6u0eszDNzi57dyKBGQ.text: We came here during our visit because my BIL was craving for some Vietnamese food.   We ordered the pho for my sister, she said it was pretty flavorful and good. Minus one star because we had to track them down for her pho, since it seems like they forgot her order.  The bo tom muc nuong vi (hot grill) was good. For $35, the portion was fair and reasonable. It came with mam nem (fermented sauce) and/or nuoc mam. I judge a place based on their dipping sauce, and this place was perfect. Not too bland, not to sweet, just right.   I would totally recommend this place. There's ample of parking, and they open pretty late, so that's cool. They also serve alcohol here, so you can wash it all down with some beer (or shots).

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tom Hoa Tien
Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bo Tom Muc Nuong Vi
Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nuoc Rau Ma

rSFibPgrukYKsAh9z4mhyQ.text: I've been coming to this restaurant for quite some time and I'm always satisfied whenever I visit! Viet Noodle Bar provides comfort pho at any time of the day. I enjoy walking in without having to worry about a seat. The staff greets you once in enter and escorts you to a seat of your choice (depending on how busy they are)  I love ordering their pho where you can choose your own meat. I usually add brisket, flank and rare steak in my pho and it tastes delicious! You also have a size option on how big you want your bowl. To me the small size is satisfying for its portion. Sometimes I order their egg rolls and it comes with lettuce and other good greens.   There were times where they didn't have brisket whenever I order a pho soup that comes with it. Lately, I think their brisket stock is back and I'm glad I don't have to worry about not eating brisket lol. Nevertheless, I'm usually a returning customer because of their excellent service and high quality meals :)

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho with brisket, flank and rare steak
Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside

sxl1FHBGJPCugGdrYdMUBw.text: Overpriced. This restaurant has taken advantage that they are the few Vietnamese restaurants in Las Vegas.   I'm not a Vegas residence but this is the first Vietnamese restaurant I have visited and eaten at, and never again!   Since they do not have competition with other Vietnamese restaurants or a large Vietnamese community here (not in comparison to Orange County, California) they completely skyrocketed their prices on a simple dish and the food lacks any flavor of delicious Vietnamese Cooking.   The price is not mediocre. It is almost $9 for a small bowl of Pho. I mean just wow! Definitely not the prices that I am used to of average ($6.50-$7.00 for a small)  Their menu is a large menu filled with the advertisement if it could be condensed it would be about 3 pages.   Food: I had the Banh Canh, it had a good portion of meat in there. But it was so plain. It had no flavoring whatsoever. Just Banh Canh, and pieces of meat that are not even flavored.   My BF had the rice dish. Just regular rice, they don't have broken rice here. TBH, even if they do have broken rice, the demographics who dines here won't even recognize the difference between broken and regular rice. I tasted the piece of chicken that my BF ordered, and it was yummy. But again, price does not just because of a small portion. It didn't come with a side soup when it should have.   Restroom: it is not too bad or dirty, it is in the back.   Parking: is a shared plaza with other restaurants. I have not been here during the daytime or peak hours to know when there is no parking or not.   Service: Nice waiters and waitress. They have an appropriate amount of employees when it is not too busy. So we did not have a hard time flagging them down.   Overall, this place thrives I am sure because it is open late at night. Most places should open late night so people can have more options. If you are visiting this area of Chinatown in the daytime, I would not visit this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mUNNuYtVWUyYDGR4-7cN5g.text: I've been coming here for months and  never get around to helping this place. This place is always packed and for good reason!  The food is amazing! The pho with rib eye is spot on and is packed with flavor. The portions are generous and the price is reasonable.   There are a few quirks to this place like full blown ads in the center of the menu and elevated booths but it only adds to the restaurant's character.   Parking is a hit or miss given how busy the plaza gets and how small the parking lot is in comparison... but that's most of spring mountain anyways.  Do yourself a favor and try this place out! You won't be disappointed...

9J2KSpOKV4yKxB5XLHpFiQ.text: First time here and this will now be my go to Pho spot!! Service was amazing and so was the food. Came in for dinner with a party of 11 and we were seated immediately. Our server Hoang was very attentive, personable, and thorough. I've never been to a pho place that asked about peanut allergies and having veggies added to the broth.   Food: Portion sizes were big! I got #30 vermicelli with eggs rolls and charbroiled pork. It came out very quick, meat was nice and tender, egg rolls were huge. I was able to try my nieces pho broth prior to her adding any spices and it was delicious. The rest of the party seemed to enjoy there food as well. No complaints here!

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AzGKjm-GScdU2zSSz0uCRA.text: I absolutely love this place. Best Pho and egg rolls around. Servers are nice, quick, and attentive.

wPKLoLtix4lMTkGCVm6zow.text: My bf and I have been regulars here for 2 years and the food has been great but the service has gone down a lot the last few times. It's not that they're rude but it's the lack of attention they pay. We ordered a rice dish and a pho and the pho got mixed up with the table next to us. We could tell it was switched before the staff picked it up. No apology yet, only asked us twice what we ordered (you should know that). We finally get the pho 20 minutes later after we share the rice dish and then there's a sorry.  Also we finished our waters a long time ago and they remained empty the whole time, they didn't offer us more water. Previous times to today though, a different waiter didn't write down our order and had to come back to ask me 3 times what I ordered. Maybe you should think to write it down at some point????   Anyway, like I said the food quality/taste is great but service really needs to upgrade.  Pay attention to your paying customers and work on having them leave happy!

0lPPgVP91F0VkQOPZlK-Bg.text: One of my favorite Vietnamese places to eat at!  My favorite dish is their Mi Xa Xiu Kho. The xa xiu they use is so tender and flavorful! I also really love their Thai tea because you get a lot for a good price. It's also super creamy and just the right amount of sweetness.   Service is spotty because they'll be quick to seat and take your order but once your meal comes, nobody really comes back to check on you until your almost done with your food. However, if you need something, just call them right over and they'll help you right away.   They get super busy at night compared to the day, especially with the grills they have so if you wanna avoid all the smell of smoke and BBQ then just come during the day.   Can't wait to come back again next time to try out the BBQ with a group of friends.

7rmNFoOZaItYmzLjPCG9HA.text: Good food!  Awesome service!  Really nice waiters always checking up on you unlike most other Viet restaurants!  Definitely will recommend to my friends and family.  Decent price too and opens late until 2am.

mvm1y9hM5WkUmXECSWH2Ow.text: Really rather average. The broth is bland and barely warm. Meat was tender enough but nothing special. In the realm of pho places, this ranks a bit high in price for what you are served.

xOLCgOBn54YzHW8hJiSGRA.text: First time eating here. There is wide variety of food. We had bun bo hue, bo cuon la nho, rice bork chop, egg rolls, coconut juice, they all tasted good.

LK89tVUNoW8LbpDI7G7fMQ.text: Great food, Great dessert! What more can you ask for? I've tried other Viet restaurants in the area and this is by far the best one. Always fresh food and prompt service. Moreover, they have double doors so you won't feel the cold draft!

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside the restaurant at 4:45 pm

xt1hPWNzwMIYmyslDhE6JQ.text: When I come to Vegas I typically stay for 3-4 days and where I'm from Vietnamese food is really limited unless it's homemade. We always go to Kim Long, but after reading reviews I had to come here and we came 3 days out of the 4 days of being here and everyone in the family loved it. The oxtail pho was very good and the broth could've had a little more flavor. Had the Com Ga Roti and the Hen was soooooooo good. The hen was cooked perfectly with super crispy skin and the inside wasn't dry at all. Next day had Com Suong Bo Dai Han and the marinade was perfect and perfect with just white rice and an egg and some fish sauce on the side. We then got to meet the owner who let us know about District One and Pho So 1 and that he's the owner of all 3. Will definitely go check out his other places. Overall everything everyone had was really good and this will be a go to place for our family when we're in Vegas

cyI31O0Tuz738tMDEPTiDQ.text: Good place. However, If I'm thinking about lunch next week, I wouldn't necessarily say 'Oh, I'm going to come here again'. I got the #26 with BBQ pork. Not convinced the pork was BBQ'd at all. Broth was ok but overall I'm under the weather so it still hit the spot. Egg noodles ok, BBQ chicken spring rolls fine. Overall not bad!

We normally always order pho, the presentation is nice and it always taste AMAZING. The last time we went, we BBQed our own pork. It was a neat experience, i highly recommend checking it out! Also, it's open from 9am-6am, so it's an awesome place for a late night meal.

b1iiVO3_sxhTyrt0TKOskg.text: This place is clean and the food is excellent. The guy came by to ask me how was everything. Great customer service. I ordered the bun bo hue and it was better than the other VIET restaurants I tried in Las Vegas so far. Definitely will come back to this place.

n-16iHCWyRT7wnju0F6s_Q.text: Ox tail Pho Bun Bo Hue Fried sweet potato appetizer rare beef salad chicken salad that skillet thing where you cook marinated beef, shrimp and squid  Al was our server. He had to be the sweetest guy and happy looking guy. We couldnt help to visit him again (also cuz the food was bomb too).  My friend and I landed in vegas after work and were tired, so something soupy sounded most comforting. It was like we hit the jack pot because the food was so good, it hit the spot. Exactly what we wanted, very homey and comforting.   I visited this spot 3x in 5 days i was in vegas.... thats how much i wanted that ox tail pho.

V8zFTORYHXEzxr-Ei0IZ7g.text: My family and I decided to come here when we first arrived in Vegas and we were not disappointed. We have tried many pho places where we're from (Queens, NY) so I would say we're pretty ok judges when it comes to whether or not Pho is good. We ordered the egg rolls and shrimp egg rolls for appetizers and they were very crispy. For the main course we had to get the ox tail pho and bun bo hue. We also ordered pork chops and short ribs with rice as well as the pho oil. The ox tail soup was amazing especially with the pho oil. The bun bo hue was also good but definitely not as good as the ox tail. The pork chop was a little dry for my taste but the short ribs were good.   For drinks we decided to try the viet iced coffee but the ones in NYC are def better.

sLFb4ht9uSj8yCWCLfnm_Q.text: The food is OK. But they are really short handed. We sat down for more than 10 minutes without getting any drink served. We tried 3 time to get the server's attention. Only one time the server came over to our table. We told them we are ready to order. He said OK then ran away. Then I saw him went back to the kitchen to deliver some noodle soup to the other table. And never come back to take our order.

LkRenLzIL1wIoZZBuFOL8A.text: Really enjoyed dinner here the other night. The barbecue pork with grilled shrimp over vermicelli noodles was awesome as was the Vietnamese egg rolls. Found out its the same owners as Pho So 1. I thought the food here was better and the restaurant seemed alot newer and nicer. Will definitely come here again. Haven't tried the pho yet but I'm sure it's delicious.

rKnHyRdblChDBlK2i1EcjQ.text: Great food and fast service. We had bo luc lac, banh xeo, pho thai, and fried rice, and raw beef salad. Everything was amazing. We made 2 visits here during our 4 day trip. Food was very affordable and tasty. We hope to visit here next time we are in town.

xjZZWZGBIg2rAH3Xt-hP8g.text: I've been here so far 3 times. As soon as you walk in you get greeted And they are so happy to see you. Very welcoming... The Restaurants ambiance is open, bright with plenty of natural sunlight. It has a very clean feel which is extremely important. The bathrooms are super clean as well. So far 3 stars for sure! Now on to the food: I ordered the bun aka vermicelli because I'm on a diet and need to lose a few Lbs before my wedding. Wow, this dish is great! Eating heathy never tasted so good!!!  4 stars now in my book. After I finished my meal, I went to the cashier to pay. My bill was under $10 dollars. That's it, 5 stars!!! #winning #i'llbeback #lovemesomeBun

FZQnw1P0dE3TsMM4voaxSw.text: We discovered this restaurant on our last day in Las Vegas. It's the best Vietnamese restaurant in town in term of service and food. Please stop by if you have a chance. We love it.

SBv2IKKwJl8drCaZEcOnYg.text: Best pho I have eaten in a long time. Very flavorful broth and the shrimp wraps were very good. I return to here every time I visit Las Vegas.

u0hxMEfKSZdImPmn_ebLEg.text: So let me start off by saying..... Amazing.  This place hits the spot for any noodle craving.  Both my friends had soups.  One had pork and shrimp udon and bun Bo he, which is a medley of meats.  They loved it! I had charbroiled chicken vermicelli and let me tell you I almost cried tears of joy.  I didn't even mention the authentic Vietnamese iced coffee and spring rolls.  When in Vegas and having noodle cravings. Go here!

WckSq0vULUxrKu_FLIWrPg.text: Pho Oxtail is the best in Las Vegas here. Actually it is the best I've ever had anywhere. Customer service is great. This place is nicely located in a corner right in Chinatown - Spring Mountain Road.

gTFIYiuoNLXbE9um3ISEww.text: First time here, great pho! Tasty broth w/lots of beef. Restaurant is nicely decorated and service is great.

Mtf34sg2LG9IfNMchmuFgw.text: We are from houston travelling to lv. We came here three times . my husband and I ordered the BBQ. the food was so good with very reasonable price and good service. But the Third time we came, at 11am, tuesday, they Were so busy. my food came out first but they forgot my husband food. But I still appreciate their service. Will come back if i have chance.

yREnD_FeaWV2YAWPkPoXnA.text: Love this place! Rolled in around 10PM looking for pho. Sometimes, you gotta have it....Had pho ga--chicken pho. It so hit the spot. Super chill place, super friendly, caring staff. Will def be back.

bhU8KQbxeAc0eR7gudAKvA.text: Ordered a basic pho, some spring rolls, and chicken and beef rice dish to start. Everything was pretty tasty. The pho broth was a little bland, but doctored up with some chili paste and hoisin sauce and mint/jalapeno/basil... it improved the taste.  Place seemed clean...except when I took a quick peek under the table before I slid into the booth seat, it looked like several days worth of food bits and crumbs were under there. But oh well, it's not like you're eating off of the floor.  Service was friendly, but not overly attentive. Our server didn't bring our check, or was able to be flagged down to ask for it, so had to pay at the register.  Felt a bit like being in the twilight zone. Why? Because there was one melodramatic song that was being looped over and over again the entire time we dined. Surprised none of the employees get sick of that song. All that while ESPN was being broadcast on the TVs.  Like the early and late hours...great for when you're craving Vietnamese for breakfast or for a late dinner.  Will try the oxtail pho next time and see if it's reason enough to keep coming back. But this first visit, nothing that really stood out to warrant coming back here soon.

9xXmPDkcQDx-Rcv50rsBbQ.text: This restaurant is very clean and every open. They recently opened a few months ago.  Most of the dishes on the menu are very good. Trust me, you will not be disappointed at all. The staff is very courteous and polite. I give this this restaurant an A plus rating.

TnQVfSAVsusTJUDn3EtRpA.text: Pho Oxtail is the best here. First stop in when I am in Vegas is this place. Viet  Noodle Bar is actually less expensive than other restaurants nearby. They are open late!  Open until 2am the day/night I went.

XMgr442V7YG8cRPQkvs8Iw.text: This is my new favorite pho place in Vegas. Starting with the restaurant itself, it is surprisingly spacious and has nice decor. The restaurant is also very clean, no sticky floors or tables. The staff was amazing, very accomodating and friendly. When my family and I ate here for dinner multiple staff members checked in with us throughout our meal to see if we needed anything. The food is delicious and for a great price. I honestly cannot get over how much I love this restaurant.

yJJXTjqTi32frR1PD8Cvlg.text: Hubby isn't too much of an Asian food fan, but I took him there anyway.   He was very pleased with his fried rice&short rib meal and my Vermacelli with shrimp was amazing!   Most places i get Vermacelli at skimp out on the shrimp especially, but these guys were very generous with theirs. I couldn't even finish mine and had to share with my hubby.  Very clean establishment and friendly staff.

3TrY-V2Aw7eErkMo2Xwizw.text: The food was absolutely top drawer...but the service was disjointed.  It was like a tag team wait staff with the left hand not knowing what the right hand was doing.

B-t41mS6dNDbf9a5eDblIQ.text: This place is a solid Vietnamese restaurant and I know, my wife is Vietnamese. She also loved this place and we down to roll back! 4 1/2 STARS The SOUPS are pretty authentic here.

Ej6FuEyzdHBamE8sq1JiYQ.text: I called & asked what time they closed, they said 6:00am. Came here at 5:25am, they said they were closed & kicked me out. They just lost money cause I was actually getting a table for a party of 6. Another couple showed up a few minutes after me, they got kicked out as well. Possibly missed out on $200 worth of food/money. Never again. I'll be at Pho Kim Long.

xn7KRRXK7fvF8WguEgHVkw.text: Kwan was the best server I've ever had at any dine in restaurant by far, I never had to get his attention because he checked up on our table so often, and was not lazy what so ever. He made it a great experience especially for some one who comes here as often as once a week. Definitely my go to spot for pho.

eunvIxvmDiUSIi0FADJDsg.text: I don't like writing negative comments but I just had to share our experience here. The place looks great, it wasn't busy, the place was half full and we got seated right away. We had a party of 9 people and the server approached our group. He took orders from one side of the table and did not come back for a little while. It's 3am and we're all hungry, so my friend waved at the closest server to order food. One person ordered a chicken wrap from the first server, and because the server never took order from the other half of the party, another person ordered a beef wrap from a different server. Apparently, because we ordered from a different server for a beef wrap, it supposedly cancelled out the chicken wrap that was ordered from the original server. The first server briefly confronted the other server in front of our table and said that stupid excuse as to why the order was mixed up and cancelled, making it look like as if it was our fault because we ordered from a different server. That is unacceptable because he never took the order for half of our party and didnt come back so we were forced to ask another server to get our order. Also, that is something you just fix, and not come up with some bullshit excuse in front of your guest. Go to the back and talk with your coworker and sort it out. Very unprofessional. As a matter of fact, I sat all this time to write this review while waiting for someone to ask me for my order, let alone if I want some water, yet no one even approached me. So I had ample time to write all of this and let everyone know how bad their service is in this place. Keep in mind that the restaurant is NOT even busy. If you don't want to risk getting blamed for getting your order mixed up, hearing excuses instead of just fixing it, or having half your party waiting to get their order taken care of while the other half eats their food, stay away from this place.

NG-ztuTZsq3KKk8PohrShw.text: The food is very good. Get the Pho Duoi Bo as it is one of the few places in LV that has it but I took one star away because the parking sucks the sweat off a dead man's underwear. Seriously, your faith in humanity will be questioned as you try to navigate that god awful parking lot. If you take Uber/Lyft or something then it's great. You can go during non busy times and get lucky but there is not guaranteed time when the lot is better. Most of the time it completely sucks. But the food really is good so rideshare over there and have a nice bowl of noodles.

eEdpSCDExjZzYpR3qYJU5Q.text: Best pho place I've ever been to in Las Vegas. Their broth has so much flavor and the staff provides excellent service.   Veggie pho is amazing, they add so many veggies and lots of noodles. Shrimp egg rolls are my favorite, and so are their egg rolls. Super crunchy and full of flavor. Chicken wings are a must to try, make sure to order them crispy. Oxtail pho, my boyfriend loved it. He said the meat fell right off the bone and was not chewy at all. Over all I loved this place. I will deff not be going back to pho Kim long anymore.

I am confused.. same restaurant, same combination pho 4 different visit, 4 different server, 4 different answers   can someone get this together? all I want is combo pho with slight modification. yet I get 4 diff answers from 4 diff servers.

YhAvKzE-0qI7C0-6E66jBQ.text: I was mad craving Pho on my last trip to vegas despite of the boiling hot weather. I ordered a plain noodle soup pho for my husband and a beef and egg roll dry noodle mix (sorry, I forgot the name so please refer to the photo attached).  I called my order in to allow ample time for them to make it while I hustled to get there from Tahiti village. I had to wait another 10mins after I arrived but I didn't mind getting fresh food. One of the waiters even poured me a glass of iced water while I wait and apologized for the delay.  The restaurant was pretty packed during the time I visited and everyone seemed very happy eating their food.   The restaurant was very clean and all the waiters provided very good refill service and table wipe down after the customers left. When my food was ready to go, the waiter hand delivered it to where I was sitting (such great service).  To-go packing was very safe even though I had to drive a distance back. All the add ins for the pho was fresh and palatable. My beef and egg roll noodle mix was so freaking delicious, it was crazy. Flavorful and fresh. If you're craving some good Vietnamese food in vegas, look no further. This is the place to go.

_w3kIDxc7V_VjPtmhY8u1w.text: My mistake of yelping the restaurant opened at late hours and I will Never go back again...my mistake of getting hungry at night looking for a soupy restaurant near by Aria...there was no basic sincerity nor gratitude to cook the food with edible ingredients.  If you couldn't have a chef to cook the a dish at the hours of operation, then just don't even offer it on the menu...the combination fried rice was a nightmare, it tasted so wet like I just stirred ingredients into it with lots of oil.  Not to mention the basic dish the combination pho, it was cold with unchewable meat.  My mistake and hope it was a helpful info.

hOJiV6hVDqEGjJ3aW39Ihg.text: We were recommended for this place from a local...I wasn't impressed nor satisfied with the result. We did get seated immediately on a Saturday lunch rush, which is the one good thing about this place.  The menu seems to be on the overpriced side. The food weren't even that great so I'm shocked they are charging this much, with so many other competitors located nearby.  I got the spring roll and I was not a fan of the sauce that came with it. It was a peanut sauce but it had a funky taste. I like the generic sweetened fish sauce that comes with it. I also decided to get the Com Suong, the pork chop was dried but had a good flavor. The veggies were limited with it. The portion was good but I wished they focused more on the quality side.   I also had a few sips from my friend's bowl of pho. The broth was ok, it was on the blander side of things.  Overall, I wouldn't come back since there are so many other options around the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho menu

AlRUSvzYxgr2g2FFRDOVXQ.text: My gf and I came in last weekend and ordered two Bun Bo Hue since most reviews on Yelp suggested this is one of their signature dishes. As someone who was born and grew up in Saigon for 25 years, I would say it was below my expectation for "authentic" Vietnamese food. The lack of shrimp paste (or mam ruoc) made the broth not as tasty as I expected, but it's understandable since there are Non-Vietnamese customers and they might not like the smell. But the broth was also lack of chili paste or sate. The flavor of fried lemongrass and red pepper is what really make Bun Bo Hue stand out from other kind of noodles. The missing key ingredients above really killed the authenticity of the dish. I would give it 3/5 stars for the food. The one star rating actually comes from the fact that when I was washing my hands in the restroom after the meal, one of their employees working in the kitchen walked in the bathroom stall to pee, flushed the toilet with his hand and proceeded to put that very hand in the faucet water for ONE second, WITHOUT washing it properly with soap, then walked back out. It made me wonder the sanitary condition of the food I just ate! The owner should take this matter seriously before somebody get food poison

izQZ-aFb0hq_kuDkIvLn8w.text: Open really late, and the pho is excellent! I always get beef tendon and brisket, and husband gets chicken. We've eaten here many times, and it's one of our favorite stops, when we're here.

Wv2V9mWmte9cg4PZ1YyDnw.text: I'm so glad I decided to venture outside of the strip. So the morning after while all my friends were dead..... asleep HAHA couple of my friends and I decided to go eat some delicious pho while the other enjoy their rest in the dungeon... (what it looked like in our hotel rooms)   I really wanted oxtail pho, this place and pho 87 were the top two choices but decided to give this place a try.   The place was very spacious and it wasn't too crowded and it looked as though a lot of locals were dining there. SCORE! haha   I immediately ordered a young coconut to cure my hangover.... you have to scoop the meat and eat the meat with the coconut water and it'll work wonders trust me.   We ordered the beef spring roll. How do they make their beef so soft? SO DELICIOUS  The shrimp eggroll DO NOT PASS order it...take a dying friend if you have to you must get it!   I ordered my favorite ox tail pho and it was BOMB. But .... it's really hard to eat an it's hot... so just watch your fingers haha   My friend ordered the bun bo hue .... WOW!! The soup is a bit thicker than the usual bunbo I get but they sure know how to make their bun bo! I said can she get a "BUN BO HUE" and he gave a look and smirked and said "you mean beuon bo hueeee..." yes, sorry I'm sorry jeez. -___- haha  The place is really clean and the air condition is on point HAHAHAH if you want to explore a bit out of the strip come for the pho here .... if you're REALLY hungover but really want pho just go to treasure island... their pho is decent too and they have room service pho AHHAA

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail pho yumm
Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Young coconut eat the meat!

wE-MdcD9g_3MYLlNPaFuvg.text: best banh xeo in town.  every other dish is good from the bun bo hue, to the pho, to the bun thit nuong, and even com ga roti.  my least favorite is the spring rolls. but with all the other good items, i don't care :)

ucyCxsVfj3R8XRj8kaoGlQ.text: Random trip to Vegas, me and my friend were hungry so this was the closest Vietnamese restaurant that was also open late.. GREAT SERVICE!!! My friend egg came out late, but they made sure we were aware and kept apologizing. But a great team, food was also out quickly and was very tasteful!!! Definitely happy customer and if I'm ever in Vegas and crazing Vietnamese food I will come here...

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

feHntmF4SiLrwDhkC9Ybjw.text: It's was OK, nice atmosphere, hot food. It's hard to compare when their a great spot anywhere on spring mountain rd. (Chinatown)

UTD_4_JXDzQACa3Qh7Y8ug.text: Bomb as FU*K. First time trying it and I was very happy with my meal.  Definitely will come back

KzfkuSUNamJRrxVy26a0Iw.text: Lot of staff but doing nothing. What the pho come after 27 min. One of the pho never come. We mad n cancel. Just a simple pho take more then 30 min??? Server never come back. No manager on site.  They never apologize. Service bad.

uE0d9cWk5E8pZI2vgS6ujw.text: If we lived closer this would definitely be our go to restaurant when we're in the mood for some Vietnamese food. Saying that my boys LOVE their banh xeo is truly an understatement. Now let me warn you, their banh xeo is HUGE...big enough that you can share with another person. So you can imagine the waiter's reaction when each of my boys order their own.  Yea my boys sure can eat :) Their Vietnamese crepe is perfectly crisp and they're not stingy with the veggies. They give you plenty of lettuce, basil, mint, etc with your meal. Another warning - they do take their time preparing this so be ready to wait awhile for your dish.  This was probably the only downfall especially when their order came out after the husband and I were almost done with our pho. The cook knew this too and apologized profusely that it took so long, which was really nice of him.   Overall, this place is good. The restaurant is pretty big with a good amount of tables and chairs. Both times we went it was pretty busy.  Although it was busy, we were seated fairly quickly. The husband especially likes this spot cause of their oxtail pho. Not only that but I believe the manager or owner even came out and greeted us personally and thanked the husband for his service which he greatly appreciated.  They also offer military discount, which is another plus!

J61jTqjzi8thI8ep7zxnZA.text: Oxtail pho is my all time favorite and hubby all time favorite is the ban xiao and of course fresh coconut

nPyi4bTs6deTL3mJiZ_R_Q.text: We came here for breakfast and walked out with a food coma. The servings were adequate and they offer bbq. They also give you the option to make your own summer rolls. Definite a must when coming to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ty-E2lhRHO030pbsdVITuw.text: It was a brisk December night, and we were in the mood for oxtail soup. We turned to good ol' Yelp for directions and this place had multiple reviews for oxtail pho... and they were also open late, very late.  So after our tour of the Neon Museum, we made our way to this non descript strip mall.  Lucky for us, Stephen's mom has a disabled plaque, and we grabbed the last parking spot in the lot.    The restaurant is the first one nearest the street, and it's a fairly large place.  We still had to put our name down and wait inside the very cramped lobby.  The wait took about 10 minutes and like any other Vietnamese noodle place, the waiter comes by almost immediately to take your order.  We ordered 2 oxtail pho, and since Stephen's mom doesn't eat much I got her a tiny side bowl of the pho and I was going to give her 1/2 of my oxtail.  I guess I am spoiled by living in Orange County, the 2nd largest population of Vietnamese outside Saigon.  The oxtail pho here was good, but not great.  The oxtail was chewy and did not fall off the bone.  I actually gnawed on it like a little puppy.  Not pretty.  The flavor was ok, but what offset that was the super generous portion of noodles they gave.  I also ordered the chicken wings which had a nice kick to it and went great with the pho.  Overall its a good place if you want a bowl of pho, and a place that's stays open until 6 am... yes, 6 am (they open at 9 am).  4 generous stars but really its more 3 1/2

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail phó! Big bowl of noodles with 4 chunky oxtails
Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wings
Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2jK0T7CzvHbLJ0PRIaKeQQ.text: This place is definitely a staple for us when we travel to Vegas. It is always consistent and delicious.   We usually get the oxtail pho, beef noodle soup (hue) that has blood and tendons in it (it's actually quite delicious) the broth is beef bone broth with tomato paste is the base. The Vietnamese fried spring rolls are delicious. There's really nothing here I don't like, honestly.  Love the Vietnamese iced coffee. You can get it hot or cold; with it without condensed milk. And if you asked for it the traditional way they will bring it out where it drips and brews for you at your table and you assemble it. Such a great place!

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef noodle soup Hue

KoRXromS8E1b5ZboB8Yqsg.text: Best Pho in town.   I always get the veggie pho and the broth is so tasty.   The restaurant is clean, modern and well staffed.   Customer service is great!   Spring rolls and peanut sauce, mmm mmm good.  Love this place.   Came with 8 others and they accommodated our party easily and took care of us!

Vamt80mx40e4LIRsjfdTjA.text: My favorite Pho Tai and Bun Bo Hue Noodle joint in Las Vegas. They have great service here as well too!

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bun Bo Hue

q3FeW6153X5JBrPvuuazcw.text: This restaurant has the best Vietnamese Pho hands down in Las Vegas. Excellent service, pricing, clean and you get your food fast. Will be visiting again in the future

0j-fWcegLzWG16WBY_anyw.text: Good food and good service, a good place to go or order to go, fast and efficient, staffs are very friendly and helpful.

SrZv_xNO2VQ5v5wKsXa3nQ.text: SMELLS LIKE HOME. . I seriously have been looking for YEARS in vegas to find a DECENT Vietnamese restaurants like the ones back home in soCAL but it has been very difficult. I know VIET NOODLE bar has been open for some time but I just never got a chance to get myself over there until the end of 2018 when I got really sick.   The staff is friendly and very quick in getting things for you as well as getting tables cleaned. I seriously love the fact that they are open SO LATE. I can come here to eat after work and not have to deal with the hassle of a long wait like pho kim long that caters to all the tourists.   The pho BROTH is on POINT for me here. It tastes like the closest flavor to what my Vietnamese AUNTY used to make for me when I was younger. Their egg rolls are also HUGE compared to what I am used too so my husband definitely loves this place as well as he critique based off of the egg rolls hahahaha.

bACSq2DEmf1eu9WgLdGznA.text: We actually stopped by Pho So 1 to eat but as we approached the door we saw that it was closed. There was someone inside who poked his head out and told us to go to Viet Noodle Bar down the street because he also owned it. So we drove down and I'm glad we did. We ordered the chicken pho, pho with meatballs and rare beef, mi bo kho, and the beef spring rolls.   The beef springs rolls had the charbroiled taste straight from the grill. There was a healthy serving of beef in each piece. The fish sauce dipping sauce was the perfect match with the spring rolls. The broth on each of the pho's were so flavorful and comforting. Perfect for the cold evening. The Mi Bo Kho broth was rich and flavorful with a depth to it that's hard to describe. The chunks of beef were super tender but a little fatty. The noodles in all of the soups were just right when it was served to us.   Staff was attentive at the right times and service was quick. The menu is pretty large and there are lots of items I want to go back to try.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef spring rolls (comes with 4 pieces).
Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mi Bo Kho.
Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho with rare beef and meatballs.

u5gnkUFKMTxffKvuWZB65Q.text: The hype is real here! We had a party of 7 and everyone was impressed with each of their dishes. Our favorites were the bo nuong vi (thinly sliced meat that you grill yourself) and bun bo hue (spicy beef noodle soup). Everything was really flavorful and the wait for tables/food wasn't too bad. I'd come back again to try other dishes out!

9f6H68pXI6GXv28Zui0XDw.text: Pho is amazing here with a clean environment. Large bowl of combination pho will surely fill you up with the generous amount of meat and noodles. I only had the pho here so dont know about anything else but will surely be back next time im in Vegas.

A_GMYTTXeUpjJKcuFcOS2g.text: Wished the oxtail was more softer on my pho, I had a struggle on chewing on the meat. The spring rolls was delicious as well as the fried rice!

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail pho

L3Nkb11Ox4I71w_rq2ahFw.text: I only award 5 stars when a place becomes a favorite. After dining here, I have to say that this place served some of the best Vietnamese noodle soup that I've tried. We had the bun rieu (crab paste noodle soup) and it was so good and on point. Secondly, we had the bun bo hue (lemongrass beef noodle soup, mildly spicy) which was great as well. Portions were good and I left quite satisfied.  It's hip/trendy inside.

bxXzrTYNo3gDrKdqc26GUA.text: The best pho here is their oxtail pho. It only comes in a large bowl, so it's great for sharing or for saving for leftovers. It comes with a surprisingly substantial amount of oxtail in the soup. Be warned, you need to use your hands to really get into the oxtail bone for the best bits of the meat. My favorite part of any soup is the broth, and the oxtail broth has two thumbs up from me!  What I enjoy about Viet Noodle Bar is that not only is their oxtail pho very tasty, but their other entrees and appetizers are also great for sharing with a group. My favorite was their Fried Crispy Rice Noodle dish. You have the option of beef or seafood. The crispy noodle is at the base and drenched in sauce with a pile of stir-fried vegetables and meat.  Other than the food, their staff has always been friendly and kind to my group and me.

BI4oJdvlgCizDjSLlnjBNQ.text: HANDS DOWN DELICIOUS!!! friendly and fast. Keto friendly options. Shredded pork and lettuce! YUM!

XlRbYJ6niuF68ilwmFWOhQ.text: This place can get packed but it's a pretty big place and the wait was fairly short. They're open pretty late and the parking lot has ample free spaces.  Not a bad place, but some dishes were strikeouts. Surprisingly their Pho noodle portion was on the smaller side than what I'm use to.  Their Banh Xeo was better than most I've tried, but their grill meat was so-so. The rice dish was OK as I was expecting an authentic place like this to use broken rice. The marinated meat was OK but have just enough taste to remind you it's Vietnamese style.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

byeF5E3rcdzlq1_HqRxczw.text: The owner of this establishment deserves 5 stars 1000000000%! He's very aware of every single table and this restaurant is pretty big!  He also stays with a smile on his face and asks how the meal was / if everything's ok, even more than the employees. I enjoyed eating here so much. The food came in fast even on a busy Friday night. We had pho (beef broth with beef flank rare steak) and it cooks with the heat of the soup, and it was quite fresh and delicious.  I also had the iced Vietnamese coffee with condensed milk and it's served in a small amount, but trust me that it's all you need because it's super strong!  Thank you for your awesome service, Viet Noodle Bar! 5 stars.

yTgpJLxSoHLVoD5Fp_cXaA.text: I always make sure to pay a visit here whenever I'm in Vegas. Why? The Vietnamese food is authentic and they have really good service. They even got Mexican servers who know how to speak the language. Ask for something in Vietnamese, they'll know it and no language barrier. The manager himself seems like a pretty cool guy and he's super friendly. for the food- the bun bo hue is definitely one of the best I ever had- the pho oxtail is bomb. Banh xeo is pretty decent. Hu Tieu is bomb and the egg rolls too. Oh and the Sam bo luong Logan waterchest nut goji berry seaweed dessert too!!!

Sl26xyzCeZjiOhDi_V518A.text: I have been trying to get this review in for so long. My family and I frequent Viet Noodle a lot, we have recommended this restaurant to everyone since they've opened. Ok, so we have been a fan since Pho So1, so we basically follow the entire family like foodie stalkers.   My kids grew up on their food and now my kids are grown they bring their friends. The food is spectacular, from their Pho to Phan Banh Hoi! But honestly we've pretty much ordered everything and it's all amazing!   I can list the entire menu, but really there's nothing I can't recommend. Just come in and experience it for yourself.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

csYIA_JhwjFWDTiCiFFTdA.text: I have been following the owner of this place since they first opened Pho 1.  I really like their food , the owner and their family because they are  really nice.  I went there for dinner yesterday with family and I was so disappointed.  Not with the food nor the service by our server but with other servers and workers.  I originally thought our server Quan was the only one working.  He was doing the best he could greeting customers, taking their orders, delivering food, refilling their drinks, checking up on them and getting their checks.  We were being patient because I thought he was the only one working and thought that they were short staffed.  I had to admit, Quan actually did pretty well considering.  So we were patient with him only to find out that there were other workers!  One was standing behind our table watching tv that was in-front of us, about three were sitting down at a table talking!!!! I was shocked that they were taking advantage of Quan working hard. They were making him do all the work! I hope the owner sees whom his valuable workers are and the lazy ones.  It's going to hurt his business in the long run.  I have to say that this is the first time I couldn't give good rating although the food and the service was great (by only Quan).  I would definitely will not return if this is not corrected because it affects my dining experience.   I cant stand to see people being treated unfairly.  It's bullying at work!

QIB1QolT1zg_RxRf-89z4A.text: It was just ok. The service is very nice and the place seems clean. The food was just ok. We had the Banh Canh Tom shrimp udon. And while the broth was piping hot and the noodles were yummy the shrimp were rubbery. And then the com chien ga. Short for chicken fried rice and the rice was lovely and so tender but the chicken was also over cooked. So that's why they got a 3. I guess giving them another try might be worth while.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The udon soup. And the broth was yummy given its a nice cold day!

aRBBlTiLWom0Enl0h_Hrgg.text: Went for the time today for lunch. Tried the Vietnamese crepe and it was great. The portion were big . Service was slow. I want to go again to try other stuff and have a better opinion of this place

a9JxhXCOxKNmvxqjJZjn7A.text: My fave pho place! Alot of meat and veggies in your bowl. Broth has good flavor. Bowl is big you can even share it with.  But service was a bit slow though they weren't busy that time.   Will dedicate come back

bFBefH0BT6uxFBB1X_xoWw.text: Amazing! Everything we ordered was flavorful and delicious! Service was great and our food came out hot and in a timely manner. They are generous with their portion as well. My favorite was the bun rieu! So rich in flavor didn't really have to add any seasoning to it just chili powder for that kick. Wanted it again the next day but didn't get to make it back

g_EQrKdWaTx1-gNBpk_mFQ.text: Great, great Vietnamese food!  Can we talk about the pho and the stews?  The broth was top notch.  Supremely beefy and full of flavor.  And the amount of delicious meat they throw in is off the charts.  Probably the best pho within 300 miles (LA probably has something comparable).    Everything else was delicious as well.  The pork chop was perfect (tender, sweet, nice and charred) and the grilled spring rolls were savory.    Can't wait to go back!

i6UQe9GeXhejPPMFwXpIAg.text: This place is always our choice for date night. The staff is always on top of their game and The Pho is so delicious! If you plan on going try the charbroiled chicken spring rolls they are so yummy!

GbBG21-7LcvCrQ40G8t5hg.text: You can always depend on an Asian restaurant to be open New Year's Day. I knocked a star off because I called prior to coming and the lady on the phone told me there was no wait so I was at the restaurant within 10 minutes. When we arrived at the restaurant, it was packed and we had to wait about 10 minutes. I understand that's not long but when I asked the guy who seemed like he was in charge, he brushed me off saying "he doesn't know if people lie about that". Usually that puts me off a restaurant but it was New Year's Day and I already tried 2 prior restaurants and they were both closed.  I'm glad I gave it a chance. The food was very good! The restaurant was clean. Service was quick. I deviated from my usual pho and got a vermicelli bowl with grilled chicken and egg roll and the boyfriend got the pho with rib eye. The broth was delicious and all the pickled vegetables with the charred chicken were wonderful!  This was a great start as my first meal of 2016!

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. First meal of 2016! Pho with rib eye and vermicelli bowl with grilled chicken and egg rolls.

yNBwYwiyJoDp2YYwNtRzcA.text: Super clean restaurant, fantastic service, and on top of that, the Pho was phonemonal. You can get a smaller size for less of an appetite, which is still a large amount of soup.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The beef pho is super delicious.

uORgBuGwzN0OYLZh2Sdjbw.text: This place is probably the best Vietnamese Pho place I've had compared to others I've been too. I used to love going to Pho Kim Long but it doesn't taste as authentic and flavorful as it used to.   I ordered the Bun Bo Hue and it did not disappoint! It's served hot and full of the intense meat flavors with a slight kick. They have a lot of different options on their menu including different desserts which I like! My family ordered other food such as the charbroiled pork and rice dish and the filet mignon and rice dish. I tried both and they were also delicious.   Overall I rate this place 4 stars! I left one star out because their service could be better. No one came to check up on us awhile after our food was served and we waited a long while to receive our check. The ambience of this place is very casual, pretty clean and the food is great quality! Not like a lot of other Pho places out here. I will definitely come back though, especially because I can't find a better Bun Bo Hue anywhere else!

JtNP2i-h_o9f8FsUEOfVdQ.text: I love the bbq here and usually get the beef and shrimp one. It's big enough for two to three people. I usually get the BBQ and large pho to share. Thai tea is good too.   Service is friendly and I like how they are attentive and keep the glasses full of water. A lot of seating too so this is the place to go with a large party.

zZnhpeVSc0-F6JYTims1ZQ.text: Our friend's daughter saw this place or heard of this place and invited everyone.  Of course!   Chinatown strip away from the main area, so definitely parking spaces and nice layout in the restaurant.   Normally get spring rolls and bun to measure Vietnamese spots.  Both solid, I thought their grilled pork was cooked well with the smoky charred taste which is a great sign.   We shared a rare beef salad and it was excellent.   Great portion and tasty.   Nice staff and accommodated easily a party of 12 ppl.   I'm sure there a ton of spots, but this place was easy to get in and out of.

SmY3YjBOU0fV6Ca3xY-xLw.text: My husband and I are regular to this place... My husband love is combination pho, and I love my porridge with shrimp and chicken... The other dish that we also love is the dry egg noodles Seafood...  My husband has try many Pho, he said the broth for his pho is better than any place he have tried...

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My husband and I are regular to this place I love ordering my shrimp and chicken porridge and my husband love his combination pho...
Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My husband and I are regular to this place I love my porridge with shrimp and chicken and my husband love his combination pho...

9RZiLLvRFg9ECOQViNFOng.text: My sister and I arrived in Las Vegas, late on a Thursday night. This place was open and we decided to try it out. The food was great- I got the charbroiled short ribs and she got the pho noodles with chicken. We also got the Thai iced tea which was AMAZING. This place had great food, fast service and attentive servers. Highly recommend trying it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short ribs
Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thai tea
Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

_e7qOVlXcwT_n1Zub5qtew.text: One of the better pho place around Vegas in my opinion. We talked to the owners and come to find out, they are related to the owners of Pho So 1.   This place was pretty big and clean which was nice. The service was pretty fast and decent.   I ordered the Bun Bo Hue, spring rolls, egg rolls and boyfriend ordered pho tai. The eggs were good! It was crispy and didn't feel like they been refried a million times.   Spring roll were only okay. The lettuce felt a little old and the pork was a little tough. The bun bo hue was pretty good! It could of had a tad more flavor in the broth but other than that I enjoyed it. The bowls were huge, which is a plus cause I can consume a lot of noodles!

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spring rolls
Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg rolls
Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bun bo hue

RfUAiUltXN5itKjvlQ3qlw.text: Great food, excellent service, quick service and fair prices.  Definitely worth the short taxi ride from the strip to try something different.

d4ckQ9_J4YM7CiQ2bzJE3w.text: Friend from work didn't feel like eating at our Employee Dining Room so he wanted to go out to eat...and he likes pho so I suggested Viet Noodle Bar.  Why?  Because I read awesome reviews about this place, from their pho to the Bun Bo Hue.  The restaurant was a decent size.  We were helped right away.  I ordered the Bun Bo Hue while my friends ordered pho.  My bun bo hue was good.  I love bun bo hue and I usually enjoy it at Pho Saigon 8.  But, Viet Noodle Bar was comparable.  The friend that likes pho prefers the Pho Saigon 8's better.  The other friend liked it equally.    The bowl is a big size so I packed half of my food to go.  Staff was very friendly and attentive.  Oh, and they served filtered water.  Yay!

WM8zcqhYx8wklrXbEpZOVw.text: It's nice place. Foods so delicious. I ordered roast hen and I like it a lot and I will come back and try another food. ^^

ger6qe_65eJ1NYg_J0gw9w.text: Right away, my fiancee and I were seated and were given water and napkins. The server attended us very well and was on top with the drinks. After choosing the Bo Nuong Vi beef specialty, the server laid several food item and asked if we have done this before. He took the time to demonstrate the process. I've never had Vietnamese food, and because of this experience, I plan to search for one in our hometown. The food was the best experience we had in Las Vegas (believe it or not). Although I have not had other entrees, I assume the other food will be as prepared nicely and tasty as were today. The food was Great! Tasty! Well prepared! If I ever come back to Vegas, I'll be back!  Did I mention the service was Great! BTW the 2016 Olympics were on the TV and the servers were rooting Team USA!

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Look at how well this was prepared! Tasty!!!

cs_JoT_mxDlXF725ZDsgEQ.text: Oh my god! What is pho kim long or pho so 1 after having this place? There are so many reasons why I love this place so much more. First, it closes pretty late at 2AM. Second, it's not as crazy and disorganized as other pho places. Third, the broth is so much better and so delicious! Lastly, SERVICE was seriously on point. Upon entering, you can see the lovely design of the restaurant and how spacious/open it is. You're immediately greeted by staff and they are very patient with you when you're completely indecisive like me! Haha. Plus they check up on you frequently and they are open to questions as well.   What we ordered? The buttery garlic wings! Contains six pieces and it was super crunchy and cooked to perfection. Good amount of butter and garlic. The taste of the garlic wasn't too strong at all.   The famous oxtail pho everyone is talking about is another dish we ordered and let me tell you, the bowls were freaking huge! You seriously can share with someone. The broth was to die for and the oxtail, super tender and very easy to eat. There was so much oxtail! If I could describe the portion of the oxtail, put your two fists together.   Bun bo hue was the dish I ordered. Oh my god. I've never been so excited to talk about this dish until now. The broth was super delicious especially with lime squeezed all over it with chili. The tendons, the pork belly, the beef, and the meatballs made me so much better. So much meat in one bowl. Our server saw my face and he told me the guy at the other table had the same reaction lol.   Pork chop with rice was ordered by my friend. Pork chop was huge and very savory and soft to eat. Definitely cooked to perfection. The rice and egg made it better along with the fish sauce provided.   The lemon grass beef on the side was super good as well. Full of flavor. We ordered it as a side and it's such a deal because they give you so much.   Keep in mind also that when you order rice dishes, you can add three meats for a reasonable price even with soups which makes me happy. I hate sticking to just one choice of meat.  Will I be back? Hell yes! This place is definitely a five star for me. I love how the restaurant set up is, it's not disorganized, and the service is outstanding compared to other pho restaurants. The food was phenomenal as well. I completely loved every bite of it. Reason why I give it a 5 is because I've never had such great food and service at a pho restaurant in Las Vegas before. Thank you for the first wonderful experience. I will be back and will recommend this place to my friends.

omJ47G6VRBhI6fhFvQ-nwg.text: This is my second time dining here. But this is my first time giving it a review. I love their food. Though I am not sure how authentic the dishes are I know they are really good and my taste buds just love them! You can taste the herbs and spices and the servers are also pleasant. Just ask nicely like you are supposed to and they can for example, give you that extra cilantro and sprouts that you like.   I just gave out a 3-star rating coz yesterday when we dined here it was really warm to kinda hot. Their a/c wasn't working well. It could have been better if they could put a sign or warning outside so at least customers would be informed and it will be better if they fix it right away. It is summer so it will really be appreciated if it is cool inside.

zZCH25y_DOf1aaclH6HdTA.text: One of the best Pho I've had in Vegas. There not stingy on the xtra sides either. Definitely would reccomend this place to everyone.

wr_k77IoBv20PJXXHpHcZg.text: Decided to give their seafood udon a try - broth was light, not overly salty or fishy. Udon was nice and chewy - contained even amounts of a white fish, squid and fish balls. Would get again!   Also got fried egg rolls, it was obviously fried after I ordered it, since it came after my udon noodle soup and it was still hot (not warm mind you) when I ate it , after polishing off my noodle soup. Only downfall was the pickled radish and carrot side - utterly disgusting. Was not fresh, not crisp and not a refreshing balance to the fried egg roll.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood Udon, So Delicious!

NN0L95BQ1Zjoef84iHibRQ.text: I haven't found many Pho restaurants in Las Vegas that I like, but Viet Noodle Bar is definitely one of my favorites.   Their broth is the perfect amount of herbs and beef flavor. The brisket is high quality being tender and not tough at all.   Overall, I would come back to Viet Noodle, I really want to try their make your own spring rolls.

ts4DG4T1VBpaT36CGx7Tww.text: This is the best pho in Vegas. The broth is so flavorful and the servings are plentiful. Great atmosphere and friendly staff.

P6AXOMK7YUeCigc__Q0Hcg.text: I'm not really a pho fan, but Viet Noodle Bar has so much more than that on their menu.  I usually have a combo plate with two different proteins.  The most recent visit was a Bun combo plate with vermicelli noodles, charbroiled beef and shrimp served with a fish sauce.  It was cooked perfectly and overall light and refreshing.  The Goi Cuon, spring rolls with shrimp and pork, are a tasty appetizer, as well, so pair those with your entree and you're on your way to a fabulous meal.  I think I've had the same waitress the last two times I've been here and she's always very attentive and sweet.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bún (vermicelli) with beef and shrimp

7fbI5Q84ge3TZdqJ1lVdwg.text: Came up from LA with my hubby during the weekend and wanted to give this place a try. I got the Pho with rare steak, tendon, and tripe and it was just okay. I found that the broth was quite bland. Had to add a lot of sauce/chili oil (very bomb) to give it a boost. But the noodles and meat were good. We also ordered the charbroiled pork spring roll which too salty.   However, I will say that the service is good. If it weren't for the chili oil that they had, the food would have lacked a lot of flavor.   Unfortunately, this one was a miss for us.

8W5M8QB5plPK28Wz7ei_qg.text: Viet Noodle Bar is our go to choice when we want Vietnamese in town, and when we have visitors too. This establishment comes from the same family that brings us Pho So 1 and District One Kitchen, but this particular one is our favorite.   I usually order the Bun Bo Hue (Hue Style Noodle Soup), although the Little Guy always get my portion of the pig's blood cubes (sadly).  The Little Guy and Little Gal always get a side order of egg noodles in chicken broth.  Sometimes, they want a little more which is fine with us.  The Husband usually gets the Pho Dac Biet (Combination Pho) or maybe the Pork Chop with rice. Sometimes we add the Cha Gio (Egg Rolls with Pork and Vegetables) too.  One of my favorite things to order from here is the Bo Nuong Vi (Beef BBQ) or Nhung Dam (Vinegar Hotpot). It's a bit time-consuming, which doesn't always work out when we have the kids with us.  But when it's just the two of us, we like to take over the table and cook our own food and wrap it up in yummy goodness.  I just love eating this, as do many others since you'll see many customers cooking up their protein and wrapping it up.  Viet Noodle Bar is a popular place and for the most part, the wait isn't too long.  They have large tables for large parties, but I would recommend calling ahead if you have a big group planned.

J5zb_b465EtM4WzFrynG1w.text: Was craving some pho so I found this place. It's a little bit off of the strip inside a strip mall. It is fairly easy to find. I ordered the oxtail pho. The broth was clean and flavorful. The portion was just right. Really hit the spot. Service was normal.  Browsing through their menu I saw some other items I definitely want to try when I come back again. But try the pho first. I really liked the broth. Very clean and clear yet still full of flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail pho

PrMkPIp4TIz_T-qzq_bzpQ.text: If you follow my yelp you would know that I love Vietnamese food. It's my ultimate comfort food. For some reason ever since I've moved to vegas I don't really crave anything else besides Vietnamese food and sushi. Out of all the places I've been to... Including pho Kim long, Nem nuong bistro, pho so 1, pho bosa, pho kinh do, pho Saigon 8 and other viet places I don't remember, this is by far my favorite one!!  I love their pho!  The broth has the richest, best flavor. It's not just salty... You can taste the sweetness from the beef bones too. They are also super generous wth their portions. I think this is the only pho place where I can't really finish an entire bowl. Their meat is tender and juicy as well. I've also tried their wrap your own spring rolls with the thin vermicelli grilled pork and shrimp. It was delicious!    All and all you should try this place out. Service is good. Food is good and the prices are very decent!
