yveoySg4kS0ipVE5IwlEPQ.text: I love that there's always so many families here. Which speaks to how great it is for groups. Large, open space, big tables and shareable plates. Food is always good and fresh. Service is pretty friendly and they're real quick with your food.

E63aUErCmGkChr5-m-SKJA.text: So this Pho place is on the top of my list for pho places. Over the fifteen years that I have partaken in Pho, in several states and several countries, Viet Noodle Bar in Vegas is on my YAY list. What makes it more exciting is that this noodle house is the city that I live in.  So in my humble opinion what makes their pho superior? Their noodles! We have stepped into a society where we want good noodles and we can taste the difference. Viet Noodle House's noodles  arewhat I noticed first. They are soft, al dente like, quite perfect. There is a big difference on their noodle quality, broth and meat used to make the perfect pho.  The shrimp springs rolls are bomb as well. Some of the best I have eaten in quite sometime. So between the spring rolls and their pho, this place seems to be a perfect pho place!  So now I am spoiled and may not be able to eat pho in Vegas unless I come here. We will see....

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spring rolls
Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho with rare steak

mXJMmUSEc3pdVRNQz8A5Og.text: So yeah. I fell off the Yelp review grid for a bit, but I'm slowly returning, pho real. What better way to kick off the "new year, new me" bandwagon mentality than with a sparkling 5-star review of my current jam, Vietnamese food.   We're only 15 days into 2019 and I've traversed over into Chinatown for Viet Noodle Bar three times already. It's crazy if you do the math. If I continue at this steady rate, by the end of the year I'd have gone as many times as the number of years your septuagenarian grandma is alive. Crazy.  Sprawling cafeteria space. Wooden accents make it feel cozy. Service is minimal conversation, but sometimes that's the best for people who hate small talk. If you sit in the booth section, they might forget about you so make sure to stare lasers and they'll remember your presence...  My bf and I love the rice plate combo! You have your choice of one, two, or three-items of various charbroiled meats. I recommend the chicken and shrimp. How can something so simple have so much flavor? I've also tried their shrimp pho, both small and large sizes, and they don't skimp out on the beloved crustacean.  It's open almost 24 hours, too. So big yes. You bet I'll be returning for you, Viet Noodle Bar.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. filet mignon plate.
Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. two item rice plate -- i chose chicken and shrimp, yesss!
Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. shrimp pho.

SuenicWkYvd1BhQJm65WCw.text: I've tried my fair share of Pho joints; and have to say that this place was honestly a little disappointing.  Food: I had the large rare steak pho with meatballs and was not super impressed. The broth they use isn't the most flavorful, and I found the noodles bland as a result and the noodles were a little hard, not soft and soaked into the soup as one would expect.  Service: The waiters did a poor job of handing out the food to the correct individuals who ordered. I would recommend that the waiters take note of positioning of guests to make this an easier process.

bLgaEupwk3jU0jUNiyjgAg.text: Overall: Don't let Viet Noodle Bar's more modernized appearance full you. Their food is legit and probably the best Vietnamese restaurant that I've had in Vegas thus far. It's definitely my new go to.  Food: 4.5  Pho Tai Chin (Pho with Well Done Flank and Rare Steak): The small arrives in a deceivingly small bowl, but it is chock full of meat. I usually eat more meat than pho noodles but I was full and completely out of pho noodles and I still had enough meat for another person. Enough about the portion, the pho itself was tasty and comparable to the best places in Orange County. The broth was full of beef umami, the well done flank was moist with just the right amount of fat, and the rare steak was tender and cut generously thick.  Mi Xa Xiu (Egg Noodles with Pork): The egg noodles had the right amount of crunch, and the meat (sliced pork and ground pork) were just as generous. Although the broth was flavorful, it was a little too salty for my taste.  Service: 5  The waiters were patient with our questions about the menu. They were also fairly attentive for an Asian restaurant and refilled our waters as needed. I was impressed by the cashier who actually reminded me to double check that my receipt had the correct orders. Lots of Asian places with throw a number at you, and you have no idea what's on that receipt.  Ambiance: 4  It's pretty clean and spacious. My only gripe is that it can get pretty smokey inside since a lot of tables order diy grill dishes that come with a little table grill.

0HoWzXux3AjuCDs6MBQ8Hg.text: Service is little on the slow side... especially when you come during the lunch rush. The workers who aren't assigned to your table don't really talk to you when you ask for more water or utensils or something. So, keep that in mind before coming here... be prepared to wait.  I always get the pho here. The combination pho is good and not too pricey for the town of Las Vegas. Coming from a Vietnamese person, the flavors, meat and noodles are there - kind of like home made but of course, with the addition of MSG. But really hits the spot after a loooong night out on the strip.  I tried other dishes here (rice dishes and specialty dishes) but found that they make pho the best here.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho ribeye

Xs9ZCQ7HoOUZaWKk_G9BfA.text: We finally came here based on everyone's recommendations that Viet Noodle Bar has the best pho in Vegas. After trying their pho, I gotta say that Pho Thanh Huong is still my favorite pho in Vegas.  I got the pho tai, and it was pretty good. The broth tasted pretty clean, but the pho was not memorable.  We also tried their spring rolls and egg rolls, but they were no bueno, both super dry. But that Bun bo hue, wow!! First time trying it, and I was very impressed!  It's super flavorful and dense with all the meats and guts in the soup. The noodles were cooked perfectly as well. I would come back for that Bun bo hue.  Service is quick and accommodating.  Another positive is that they're open til late.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bun bo hue

YkBii-ZFLKrt1lqrslvi9A.text: 4.5 stars. Wanted to give five stars for the food but some of the little sauce dishes on the table were oily (i.e. not cleaned well), and they only offer disposable chopsticks.  My Viet friend recommended Viet Noodle Bar as one of the better Vietnamese restaurants in Las Vegas, so I decided to check it out. I am currently transitioning to nights in preparation for a month of night shifts, so I went for my meal at 4PM, when the restaurant was fairly empty. The restaurant itself is quite large and spacious, and is also very clean with dark-colored decor.  Service was prompt and fairly attentive, with multiple water refills. The menu is of a decent size, though I found it amusing that there was a full page of just advertisements. Viet Noodle Bar offers some hotpot/grill items that are more unique in addition to pho, vermicelli, and broken rice dishes.  I opted for oxtail pho on this visit. Even though I love oxtail and have it regularly, this was actually my first time ever having oxtail pho! I took a sip of the broth before adding in the condiments, and it was phenomenal! Lots of flavor, piping hot (just how I like it), and not too oily. You get a decent amount of meat too (three bones in my bowl this time). The bowl itself is fairly large; there is only one size option for oxtail pho. While I missed having cuts like tendon and tripe found in traditional beef pho, the oxtail pho was a very satisfying dish overall. I was expecting the meat to just fall off the bone, but I guess it wasn't cooked quite that long since it took some effort to get all the meat off. I was given a plate, fork, knife, and special sauce to deal with the oxtail. Oxtail pho at $11.95 is several dollars more expensive than normal pho on the menu, but oxtail is usually expensive in the grocery stores too so it's not unreasonable.  Overall, a great dining experience and I'd love to come back and try vermicelli or rice dishes next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail pho.
Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Exterior.

vb1PNMgFKbKt8IbNVv7b7g.text: While on vacation, my family and I ate here last night. We all had various pho bowls, along with spring rolls (Shrimp no pork) and Fried Shrimp rolls. Normally when we eat at Vietnamese restaurants, we would have to add hoisin sauce, along with the hot sauce. That wasn't the case with this restaurant though, because the broth was outstanding. The shrimp spring rolls, along with the shrimp eggroll was some of the best I've ever eaten as well, three different dipping sauces for both were included (Fish sauce, Peanut sauce, along with sweet & spicy). I wish we had a restaurant back in Maryland that had OX TAIL PHO! This particular Pho was so good, that I was tempted to order a second bowl had I not been so satiated! I'm tempted to go back tonight with my family again for the barbecue; we shall see!   p.s. I've read some of the "So-So" reviews of this place, and I can tell you, they are far reaching to say the least. My wife has a slight Gluten intolerance, and because the 1st waiter was a "Little Light" on his English, he quickly got another server to help decipher what she could and couldn't eat on the menu. Afterwards, every waiter that passed our table, was assisting with mostly every need we MAY HAVE HAD (Because we didn't have any.), and OUR water glasses were never empty. Nor did we have to "set them on the end of the tables", as another person here said she normally would do.  I'll finish with, "IF VACATIONING IN VEGAS? GET THE HELL OFF THE STRIP! Your journey will open your eyes to an array of awesome restaurants! PLACES WHO ARE MORE THAN WILLING TO CATER TO YOU LIKE YOU TRULY MEAN SOMETHING!"   Besides, SOME, of the tourists I've come across while being a tourist,,,,,where just rude as H**L. They have absolutely NO HOME TRAINING/RESPECT for others.

o6AKkuTbsLG-GpaGVhVgpw.text: The staff were friendly and we got seated quickly but I was disappointed with the pho and fried egg rolls. The star anise and cinnamon overpowered the broth and the egg rolls were little soggy. Extra star for clean interior and tv flat screens to watch games.

6WpOxRCTcgH-SuqygOR-MA.text: Driving up spring mountain decide we felt Like pho, stopped in and were seated right away. Our server was so friendly! He answered all Of our questions and we enjoyed a great meal! Definitely recommend the place.

ZlTeQENiKkzog5oy78KJCQ.text: Really good authentic Viet food. More varieties than any other Viet restaurant. Everything I ordered from rice plates, pho, and make your own spring rolls, desert....ALL delicious. Can't go wrong with anything you order.

r40glI4MZimkUvp_NSv5Ew.text: Their Ox tail pho is good, the soup hit the spot! The only thing was that they had only 1 size and it was too big so I couldn't finish it. I also ordered EGG ROLLS which was fried to perfection. It came out with a lot of veggies on the side which I really liked.

Fon4R7tFuKmvM7tNbmmqfA.text: Service: The workers were kind and helpful. Rather then just regular play in service, they were actually social and friendly. Food and drinks did not take long at all. Food output seemed fast. The other servers/workers were also helpful.  Atmosphere: The appearance of the place is very nice. Clean, kept well, decorated, and pretty big/roomy. Very pleased with the appearance of this place compared to most Vietnamese food restaurants that I have been to.   Food: The main reason I rated this place a 4/5 was because of the food. everyone with me enjoyed their food and as a Vietnamese person myself in my opinion the food tasted authentic and delicious. I personally got the Bun Bo Hue + Thai Tea. The Thai tea was great and very good size. Bun Bo Hue was also very good and well made. Would definitely recommend this place for those looking for delicious Vietnamese food.

ky7drnptNOyqcXMWX26CLQ.text: Stopped by here for a late night dinner after the club, their rare steak pho and fried calamari rings were delicious! I'll definitely be a customer again when I come back to the area. 10/10! Thanks for the great service.

BIFSPtEiGlPH84rIhBiLXg.text: Update: Went there again during slow hour on a weekday, got oxtail pho and charbroiled pork, whole experience was pleasant. The broth was real, totally different than last time.

TDhwyrekk7gRmtF83nIjpg.text: Oxtail and beef pho were great! Spring roll and shrimp cake on sugar cane were a ok. Not quite as good as Out the Door, but then that's why Out the Door chef has a cook book.

fzoCaw8RjMMFd_GOdpbIvw.text: I didn't (and still don't) know much about pho. However, my date informed me that she is an expert, and this was the place to go, so off we went. I was immediately on the lookout for large families. This is usually a good sign, and I was not disappointed. Many families slurping noodles.  Service was good. We were handled very quickly, and the pho came out soon thereafter. All in all, I was very impressed with the food, the service, and the overall character of this place. I would certainly come back to experiment with some of the broth variations (ox tail?!).

FxkU6mgP18peMTMt3DL5dg.text: Decent place to get your Vietnamese fix if you are looking for a place off strip. If you're tired of waiting in line at pho kim long then just head on over here ..food was legit and service was good. They do get busy but they do accommodate to your needs. They don't open late like kim long does but that's ok..people have lives to live too..lol

Gzl0a5PtiqIP4m6ksm0saA.text: First time here, came here based off of yelp reviews and it did not disappoint. I ordered the wonton noodle soup with rice noodles. Rh6FQQE6uC7D-TRZsc5uMQ.text: Visited this place again last weekend and their pho was still AMAZING!!! We ordered beef pho and shrimp fried rice this time and both tasted DELICIOUS!!! LOVE LOVE LOVE this place!!  and servers are all very attentive!!

ZeLL1ycjOnHkObk8Np7kVA.text: We got seated pretty fast, but I've been sitting here for the past 10minutes and still no waters or anyone that's come by. There was a party of 6 that came after us and got their waters already. Pretty pissed. I just want my food.

8C4rJw1Zs_n7Zy9PZkcicw.text: After a long weekend of eating diner food on our road trip from UT to AZ to NV, this was a welcome respite. Visa/MasterCard accepted!

wu1hWYjTv_cTvYK2i_GFsg.text: We have seen the restaurant sign for many times and we finally got here late night. We ordered shrimp spring rolls. It was crispy and taste good. 1-0THdM5BTzz4vdKtR7fKQ.text: We are pho connoisseurs and this place does NOT specialize in it. Maybe the high ratings are for other foods? We also ordered banh canh (viet udon) and nothing special and small portions for $12!  Pricey place not worth it.

jQKLn4oK5AdXjxvTJ5sJYg.text: This is my official to go place for pho. The service is fast and friendly and most importantly it's clean. The broth is always consistent and delicious. ab-5LaZ7ihLhHYZ08viu0Q.text: Tried the oxtail soup and it was okay. The meat fell off the bone and the broth was good.  They did give a lot of meat on the other pho soups.  The egg rolls was normal, nothing spectacular.

sh3MvAEXvjPX3fX88GrT4A.text: The noodle soup is really good and I like the Vietnam BBQ roll as well. Many of such Pho restaurants put a lot of MG in the soup so make you thirsty afterward. But this one not, and they give fairly enough veges for you to put into it. Ventilation was not good, you will get smelly if other clients ordering BBQ.....

Os50lsHwf098N8SfW4iSnQ.text: I have to say this is by far the best pho in Vegas! When I yelped it, 4.5 stars really set the bar high for me and they did not disappoint. First of all, the place smells really nice and clean. We were greeted by 5+ staff members that welcomed us, seated us, cleaned a baby seat for my niece, and brought water/tea right away. Our waiter was so friendly and helpful (his name is Steve) and he was just wonderful! I highly recommend this place and I will never have pho elsewhere!  The shrimp spring rolls are LIFE!!!

TCb9EUb6f7G3qY-sofhjwQ.text: Clean.  New. Modern decor Vietnamese restaurant that serves from pho to egg noodles to your favorite grill on the table wraps. Haven't tried the BBQ grill on the table yet although it looks and smells wonderful - but have tried their egg noodles dry version, BBQ beef and pork rice dishes, lemon grass vermicelli, shrimp paste and pork patties vermicelli, pho and Bun Bo Hue noodle soup. The egg noodles dry version is pretty legit. It's not overlooked and has the perfect texture what a good bowl of egg noodles should be. The soup that comes on the side is on the salty side and doesn't have much flavor of a pork broth. The vermicelli and rice plates are good too. The pho is so-so, I only ordered it for my kids since they love pho. The Bun Bo Hue was a disappointment. Noodles were way over cooked, soup doesn't have much lemon grass flavor and it has too much meat going on in there from tendons to pigs skins to pieces of slices of beef shanks and meat patties like. The pork blood wasn't fresh - has a stinky smell to it and there weren't enough Vietnamese herbs and vegetables that should come with this noodle dish on the side. Let's just say, i would not order this again. Will I be back? For sure for their egg noodles and maybe try out their BBQ grill on the table the next time we are in town.

cRvrWJWYWPOKRTw_l87dHA.text: Butter spring rolls was bomb.com.. I also had pork and shrimp banh canh and I finished the whole bowl.. It was delicious. My friends also ordered bun bo hue and pho, they Said it was also good. Definitely will come back when I'm in town.

65tzP__xOWQKVdmGlIeOUg.text: Oh yeah that's what I'm talking about.  Delicious and, importantly on Spring Mountain, CLEAN restaurant.    Had the pho and it was delicious.  Meat might have been a little overcooked but I also may have left it in the broth too long.  They gave me a ton of meat too - kind of ridiculous.  When I thought I had finished all the meat I discovered this huge amount at the bottom of the brother.  Will have to try the oxtail pho next time.  Also tried the bbq beef - delicious too.  They serve it with all the fixins to make your own spring rolls.    I really like this place.  Automatically my favorite pho place in town.

mx3ouqlzc5NKrHId1hBKmA.text: Viet Noodle bar is absolutely amazing!  We love their Pho and their Thai Iced Teas are soooo on point.  Definitely a MUST TRY when it comes to Pho in Vegas.  Let's face it, there's a lot of Pho spots in Vegas, but not a lot of AMAZING Pho spots and this is one of them!!!

kMcsXW0HK-15eh_e78Hyog.text: Place is ok. Super busy and the staff is friendly. Food takes a long time, though.

CdevYb9Tyua7MgGhPhJ79g.text: Quality eats and service. Nice vibe and dining atmosphere. Bun bo hue saved me from alcohol indulgence. Will be back to try the pho and other offerings. Huge menu. Everything coming out of the kitchen looked fresh and worthy. I 86'd Pho '87 for good.

z3ZST6jVk_UrtsrNcBZMKw.text: I think this is the same owner as pho so 1 and district one.    Food-  The food here is much better than pho so 1.  It's almost like they know that pho so 1 is not very good so they decided to make it better with this place.   The pho broth is rich and meaty. I just wish that the was a bit more cinnamon to give it a bit of a herbal taste.  They are very generous with their meat portions also.   Although the brisket and flank are a bit tough.   Their grilled pork is pretty good,  But I would still have to say the best grilled pork in Las Vegas is the Da Lat.  Also had their grilled beef which you wrap with fresh vegetables and noodles with rice paper. unlike the salon and other places there grilled beef was so flavorful and tender. That was quite a surprise. and they give you woven noodles.  Definitely try this with both the fish sauce and then the anchovy sauce. The anchovy sauce smells like dead shrimp and dead anchovies were buried together in 1912 and found in the desert in July of 2015. But somehow it's still delicious.  This is a great option if you want low-carb.  Service here is fast like Pho So  1 but more friendly and attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled beef!!!!! Flavorful and tender.

y88G15TrFl5gmUV1CZfcOw.text: Banh Xeo!  I love that they offer it here since it's not something that you can find easily in Las Vegas.   Comes in a generous portion!  Their Bun bo hue is also tasty as all hells as well.  I like that it actually tastes like how it's supposed to as opposed to a bunch of other places that use the broth of bun rieu trying to pass off as bun bo hue.  Will be coming back here againnnnn :9

kIPWzEvyMWD-bt6tXoKTXQ.text: My Go-To for Pho in Vegas. Located on Spring Mountain (near Chinatown) where you find most of the decent Pho in this town. If you know me, you know how much i love Pho. And how I'm a pretty big Pho snob (I've tried it all). That being said, this place is pretty amazing. Robust broth, tender meat, the noodles have perfect texture and fresh-fragrant ingredients. It's the best thing on a gloomy day or any day of the week imo.   I usually order the same thing every time: #1 Cha Gio (crispy egg rolls) served with big leafy greens not the sad wilted lettuce you'll find at other restaurants.  #9 Pho Tai large (rare steak) usually the difference between large and small at most places isn't very noticeable but it is here. If you don't want to leave on an empty stomach, opt for the large bowl.  And Hot tea - it's good for the soul and cold water is served automatically.   The Charbroiled Pork Spring Rolls, Ox-tail pho and Bun Bo Hue are all solid choices. Another notable mention is the service. Unlike most Vietnamese restaurants where you order your food, you receive your food, then never see your waiter again; Viet Noodle Bar really stands out for their service. It's one of the many reasons I keep coming back. The staff is friendly and attentive. My water glass is refilled without asking, i get extra napkins when needed, they always come back to see if you need anything else. Much appreciated.

VVF0u4K4iw9Oah_PRFXzOg.text: Fresh seafood with soup, amazing tasty pork chops . Parking is available and service is good

baAh4_-RtzURIOigSyPMXA.text: We were visiting from Ca and had a craving for pho one afternoon...so what is a girl to do in order to satisfy a craving? Open up her Yelp app, of course. So based on the reviews on Yelp, we picked this one. Their pho was so pho-king amazing...please excuse my language. I'm vegetarian so I got the vegetable pho...best vegetarian pho ever!!! I used to eat meat, so I know what non-vegetarian pho tastes like as well. The vegetables were crisp, the broth was piping hot...add a dash of sriracha sauce and hoisin sauce and I was in Pho heaven. Mmmm, I'm craving pho right now...but it's almost midnight. The size "small" was actually a good size for me...the portion was like a normal sized bowl that a normal sized person would eat.The large would've been too much food for me. I had to look good in my little black dress that evening, know what I mean?   I'll be in Vegas again next weekend with my friend...we'll definitely stop by here. Two thumbs up...5 stars. I would move to Vegas just to eat here...but then again, the summers are brutal there, so nevermind. K, bye.

aNPQ1qdb9ysHpja3H3x96g.text: The restaurant is very clean and has a chic and modern look. The servers are friendly and attentive. The food was pretty good. We ordered 2 pho, one with tai bo vien, and one with nam bo vien. Broth is very delicious. We also ordered the eggroll (the crunchy one) and the spring roll (the fresh one). The egg  rolls are good. The spring rolls are okay, it could be better. I just don't like the dipping sauce, it's a bit too sweet and there's a weird smell, not like a stinky smell but it doesn't go with the sauce. Maybe they do an updated version and it's different from authentic version? Maybe someone likes it, but not me, I like it authentic! (and I'm Vietnamese, if that helps)

rd2L3HvIj8uxqs8iW-jY-A.text: Very quick service  I ordered the combination pho, rich and well made broth. Not bad quality meats either and my tendons were cooked long enough that they weren't chewy. Only complain were my noodles were a tad bit overcooked.  Would come back

uCS5HcfvcZreFPOGf-iAuA.text: Phoking amazing... If i would i would give 100 stars... I would recommend this to my mom... This is Good food...

s_5jO3YoPI9dQf1TSDnp-w.text: I really like this place. They have tons of menu items outside of Pho. Don't get me wrong, the Staples like Pho, egg rolls and spring rolls are good but break out of your comfort zone and try Bun, or do your own rolls with one of the Banh Hoi options. I have been going to Pho Kim Long for their late hours and Pho So 1 for decades. I finally gave this place a try and didn't regret it. Viet food is authentic and they are open till almost midnight and are more up to date offering Postmates delivery.

IWs83r7BA0EICMMMg1l2aA.text: I'm actually not a huge Pho fan but this place has converted me.  Decided to try this place out last week. After looking at a few places I decided to go with the ratings and reviews that I had seen previously. People had it spot on.  My vegetarian friend went ahead and started off with the spring rolls. Pretty tasty. Very fresh. Everything came together really well. We gave them a five out of five. You can always find vegetarian dishes at Thai places but the freshness and the care that went into putting these together definitely reflected in the taste. 5/5  I went with the shrimp eggrolls. Nothing over-the-top fancy about these but simple is elegant. Whole shrimp wrapped in an eggroll wrapper deep fried and served up with a traditional sweet-and-sour sauce. Add a little soy sauce to the sauce and it hit perfectly. Also 5/5.  Now for the fun stuff. Once again my vegetarian friend went ahead and decided to get the vegetarian option for the pho. The noodles were amazing. They have the amount of vegetables topped off the plate, with a side of Thai basil and sprouts. The broth had a great flavor as well. Also a 5/5.  I went ahead with the chicken wonton variation. I'm a huge fan of wontons and soup dumplings and these were pretty good. Pho restaurants aren't typically known for their wontons and these weren't the best ever but still pretty good. The chicken stock or broth was very flavorful and the portions were pretty big. We had gone with the regular sizes instead of the large sizes and we were glad we did. I also gave us a five out of five.  Overall the place is extremely clean and the staff was very attentive, friendly, and eager to help out with any choices you have.

Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spring rolls.

hTsMr1k2BPOEq_clX87fiA.text: Go to pho spot.  Nothing makes my heart full than good wholesome food around the corner from my home. There's a crap ton of pho shops littered on Spring Mtn but this place has a hold on me and the fam.   The hours are great, 9a-6am this is awesome I don't worry everrr if there closed.  The restaurant location is ideal, it's in a strip mall on top of the Spring Mtn hill, parking is easy you don't have to compete for parking. Inside is clean, plenty of seating to accommodate large groups and booth seating is a nice touch.  The Pho: It's incredibly flavorful, the clarity of the soup is redic..gets my man every time. They're very generous with meats and toppings, and just plain great pho.  Some of my other favorites are the Banh Xeo, it's freaking huge you can definitely share but I don't. It takes awhile to prepare so be aware..it is worth the wait my friend. Bun bo hue, vermicelli noodle salad with beef/shrimp is bomb bomb.   Nothing bad I can say about this place, aside from time to time they'll run out of select entrees and during holidays this place gets nuts like the rest of Chinatown.  5 thumbs up, my dudes.

N7VMjbIk_XRSWpD80hqxMA.text: I love that this place is still open when my midnight cravings.  I highly recommend the charbroiled beef spring rolls and oxtail soup.    The oxtail soup is so delicious!  Noodles and meat cooked to perfection!  The oxtail fell off the bones and made it easy to eat, noodles not too soft and broth seasoned very well.

E45PCdUYvE3vOv_w-Wv_4A.text: Walking in, the ambience is quite modern and spacious. Ordered Bun Rieu (tomato crabmeat noodle soup) and it was delicious! The portion is huge and the broth is flavorful. Would come back here for bun Rieu just because a lot Viet restaurant don't serve that!   The quality of service is also very nice as the servers keep refilling our water cups and accommodated to our requests.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 36. Bun Rieu

Ghmf7IOfeBpakQnm53sNQg.text: I wish I could give this place more stars because the food was amazing!! However, the service was terrible!!  I'm not sure what the sign in sheet is for, because they seated people who signed in after us. Also, we were waiting in the little waiting area for 10 minutes before we finally just asked someone if we could sit down.   Finally at a table, waiters walked everywhere near us, but nobody actually came to our table. My mom had to flag a guy down to take our order. (2 orders of fried egg rolls, chicken pho, Vietnamese coffee and a Thai tea) The waiter got our egg roll order wrong.   Not once did anyone come by our table to ask if we needed more water, coffee or tea. I had to ask for the check. It was really ridiculous, and quite frustrating.  Now the good stuff.... the food so yummy!! The pho broth had so much flavor, and the bowls were HUGE!! Also, when the correct Order of egg rolls came out they were delicious - the food made the waiting and flagging down not so bad.

x4ur7brd-lqdQigY5Vuo5A.text: Viet noodle bar is located right off the strip! It's a great place to get quality Vietnamese food, there were so many options. We ordered the combination pho and vermicelli with egg rolls. I had a spoonful of the combination pho which was great. The broth was flavorful! I loved the vermicelli - veggies were fresh and egg rolls were crisp and amazing! The portions are very generous. The food came out really fast too, maybe within 10 minutes or less! Service is great. Parking is right outside in the lot and free. Highly recommend this place if you're craving pho!

SBG6w6KmFPfHvY6Il9SkLQ.text: This is my favorite place for Phan Banh Hoi Bo Nuong La Lot / Woven Vermicelli with grill beef in Betel Leaf. It comes in a platter with fresh lettuce, mint leaves, cucumbers, pickled daikon/carrots and fresh small sheets of rice paper for you to roll your very own spring rolls. This dish can be shared or if you're like me, I indulge it all by myself.   Most of their other dishes are good as well. They have a great variety of choices and everything always comes out fresh.   The service staff are all very friendly and fast! I've never had a problem on my orders and they are always welcoming.

wuIYVqQXAuHIUxpr4_C4NQ.text: Our first time here and everything came out genuinely delicious! I ordered their combination pho while the husband picked a vermicelli dish.   My order turned out just perfect however his vermicelli looks more like salad to me. I thought it was overwhelmingly filled with greens than the noodles but that's just me though. Also, I've had better fried eggrolls but it was still good.   The restaurant was pretty spacious but I think they get pretty busy on certain hours. So I recommend giving them a call regarding wait time if your coming in with a large group.   Husband also ordered their thai iced tea, he said it's very creamy and not too think which he prefers. I would definitely try their other drinks on my next visit.   Service is quite exceptional as well. Food came out quick and our server was very attentive.   I'll definitely come back and recommend my  friends to check this place out.

Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9VpMiUwa56xTs2-k3u8nJg.text: Left the club at 1:30am because Cardi B doesn't perform at Kaos until 3:30am. Decided to get food and was craving some soup. NO REGRETS! Food is pretty good, and it's about a 5 minute Uber ride from the Palms.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 27. Soup Wonton

RF6_vmIPGoygW95T2u1Sbg.text: Wow, just wow. The pho here is spot on. I tried the combination pho and it blew me away. Service was quick and the place has a sports bar vibe. Come here for the fantastic pho and you won't be disappointedm  The combination pho came with honestly some of the best broth I've had. Not too heavy but packed with umami flavor left and right. The noodles were not too soft and the bean sprouts were crunchy. The bowl was packed with meat and tripe.  I usually load my pho with sriracha or hoisin sauce but I didn't this time. It was that good.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combination Pho

zuvEdt1PJVjIA-w438OFvA.text: Viet Noodle Bar In Spring Mtn.  Wife ordered vermicelli with egg roll. It had chopped veggies under the noodles. She has a medium appetite but the dish was so good, she almost ate the whole thing. Everything was well prepared including the large quantities is egg roll.   I ordered Oxtail Pho. Had 5 pieces Oxtail, mostly fall off the bone. Lots of noodles too. This Pho and Oxtail meat is the best I've ever had. The broth was clear and tasty.   Both dishes had an excellent balance of flavors. No spice or ingredient was dominant in either dish. All the food just blended together for wonderful meals.   The place looks like and feels like a cafeteria. Don't let the looks deceive you, the food is excellent here.  I will dine here again on every trip we have to Vegas. 10 out of 10.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #10 Oxtail Pho
Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #30 Vermicelli Noodle with Egg Roll
Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bZkI27QQR5VEF2UHvT3U7A.text: My sister and I decided on Viet Noodle Bar after a night at the club since our usual place had closed hours prior.   They stay open LATE, which I appreciate.  No sane person wants fast food after a night of drinking alcohol lol.  She got pho and I ordered beef/broccoli with steamed rice, #40.  She is really particular and didn't seem to enjoy the pho compared to the other spot we go to.  My food on the other hand I liked way better.  I feel like the other place's food is more bland whereas Viet Noodle makes sure to season your food.  If you are one to savour the flavour then come here because they have it!  However, you have a sensitive stomach then I'd try elsewhere.  Customer service was good and the food came out in a timely manner.  It was around 3:30 a.m. on a Saturday night "Sunday morning" and there were still a decent amount of people inside so obviously we weren't the only ones with the idea.  The food was satisfying and I felt full afterwards.

SJM-QnS4QL4irl_Woz7GjA.text: This is the third pho place I have tried in Vegas since I moved here, and I will say it is my favorite one so far over here. Upon entering, there is plenty of room and plenty is seating, which is nice for a pho place. We were greeted right away and seated right away. My husband and I both ordered the large combination pho. We did wait a little while to receive our food after placing our order, but it wasn't a ridiculous long wait.  Once we received our food, we dug in. The broth is significantly better than the other pho places I have tried in Vegas (please note that the pho places I tried were not in Chinatown. I know I need to try pho places over there.) The noodles were decent and the meat was decent as well. I have had better pho places in the Bay Area, but overall, it is a decent pho restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Large combinations

SkUSac52JK_Ipuaqt-19Sg.text: I alwasy love trying new places. I saw the spring rolls with peanut sauce. I got very little noodles and a lot of green. The peanut sauce was not mixed very well. It was grainy. I also got the #9 chicken. It was okay. Broth was good. Chicken was all white meat. I would normally try a green tea ice cream or something but all that had was flan and babo like drinks. Service was fine. Not outstanding but okay. This trip just felt okay cause the disappointment in the peanut sauce and spring roll. Doesn't look like I'll be returning just wasn't a good experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #9 chicken pho
Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Springrolls

RFpc0km4dmmTekKc6gYlrA.text: My friends wanted pho so we decided to go for Viet Noodle Bar due to the high reviews on Yelp.   I only eat Viet food in Socal, so I wasn't too sure what to expect. I was a little skeptical since we were in Vegas. Our group of 9 came at 12 PM on a Monday. It was fairly busy, but not too bad. They do have a wide variety of Vietnamese food, but their portions are huge, which means prices were higher. I prefer smaller portions and lower prices.   l Our Order |  Cha Gio ($7) - 4 pieces of egg-rolls with pork and vegetables. My friends said that this was a good appetizer. You can't go wrong with egg-rolls.   Pho Bo ($9) - Beef noodle soup with the following meats: brisket, tripe, flank, tendon, fatty flank, or rare steak. All of my friends said that their pho was just okay, very mediocre, nothing unique.   Bun Bo Hue ($11) - Hue style noodle soup with a side of vegetable dish. Based on the color of the soup, you can tell it's a lot of coloring. It didn't look that appetizing to me, lacking in flavor.   Banh Canh Hai Vi ($11) - Seafood udon noodles with shrimp, squid, fish, and fishball. My friend said it wasn't bad, but she had better.   Com Bo Luc Lac ($14) - Steamed rice with store fried filet mignon. My friend enjoyed this dish.   Bo Nuong La Lot ($15) - Grilled beef in betel leaf with woven vermicelli. This portion is so big, it's meant for 2 people to share. The beef was way too dry and not juicy. We did not enjoy it at all.   Overall, the presentation of their food is nice, but portions are too much for one person to finish. The quality is not really there and service was pretty slow. Prices are quiet expensive compared to your average Vietnamese restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bo Nuong La Lot

yZAV3d916in3pw8MlOKCiA.text: This place is probably my favorite Vietnamese restaurant in Las Vegas. I haven't found another place that tops it but haven't ventured out to find other Vietnamese restaurants either.   Last time I was there, my wife and I ordered 3 dishes.  1. #1 Egg Rolls : the egg rolls here are on point. They cook it to a golden crispy perfection. Paired with the wide assortment of vegetables and fish sauce. Can't say I went here without having this dish as an appetizer. *****  2. #10 Oxtail Pho : this is probably in my top 5 pho I've had and I've had a lot of Pho in many different cities around the world. I prefer this dish over the other standard pho like the dac biet which is what I usually order elsewhere but since they have the oxtail, I'm aleays ordering this. I like how the oxtail creates a slightly oily but rich flavor in the broth and noodles are always cooked to perfection. *****  3. #53 Beef BBQ : this was ordered on a recommendation from the waiter but we meant to order the #56 which should have been more than enough food. This dish is a cook your own beef dish where they bring out a grill and you cook the beef at the table. The beef tastes similar to Korean bulgogi but comes with a plate of lettuce, sprouts, carrots, few other leafy greens and rice paper to wrap it in. The flavors are good and portion size is decent for the price. ****  The service is great here. They don't bother you every 5 minutes to check to see how you are doing which I personally don't like during a meal. If you need something they are prompt with your request.   As far as ambiance, there really isn't one. It's just a noisy restaurant with TVs all over the place but nonetheless I enjoy going here to get my Vietnamese food fix.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1. Cha Gio
Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #53 Beef BBQ

aiiEfW2GbTIVzgxIi7IiCw.text: Only vietnamese restaurant will go to. They'll substitute between menu to make sure you get everything you need.   Best pho in Vegas,  Try ordering menu item number 56, make your own spring-rolls and rib-eye pho number 11. best combo

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib-eye pho menu number #11 and make your own spring-rolls menu item #56

pkx4qErqn8QGBnZ2BEPe_A.text: wow, definitely some of the Best Pho I have had in a while. Viet Noodle Bar has an wide Vietnamese menu expanding from rice plates to Pho and appetizers.   We came here for a late lunch and we came away impressed and full. Their pho is very reasonable priced along with the rice plates. My friends ordered the oxtail pho while I ordered the combo pho with four meats. The restaurant does not hold back from piling on the noodles and the meats in the bowl of soup. For an entree under $10, I struggled to finish every last bite of my flavorful Pho. The broth had a clean finish as it was not too oily. The beef flavor along with all the cilantro and greens were a perfect combination.   Service was good. The service started out very well but then gradually tapered off. It's still better service than most Asian restaurants though. The restaurant dining area is spacious and clean and it has an inviting atmosphere to it. I can now understand why Viet Noodle Bar is one of the highest rated Vietnamese restaurants in the Las Vegas area.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. combo pho for under $10

oM9wCghRS2jeeAA8fsDoRQ.text: Let me just say... that this place made me wanna smack somebody's momma with chopsticks it was so good.   Literally just got off the plane and wanted Vietnamese food and I am SO happy we came here.   Whether you get the broken rice or vermicelli, I definitely recommend getting the charbroiled pork. The meat was so tender and flavorful. I'm so full right now but I could go for another bowl it was that good.   Solid 5 star. All the food my friends and I ordered was delicious. The service was fast and friendly and we didn't have to ask extra of anything because they gave us more than enough sauce to begin with.  If you're thinking you want Vietnamese food, just come here! You won't regret it.

rq22VK48Pbg64AGv-mcCsA.text: Second time, twice as nice! I had the bun rieu last time, which I had to be remided, but this time I took a leap of server's faith and tried the oxtail pho! I don't normally eat pho out, but it was so good I didn't need to add but a drop of hoisin, which prematurely added before tasting broth alone. It was just perfect!!! Of course I added all the herbs but honestly, not too salty or aromatic with spices or bitter from cooking/simmering too long! I ate the entire gigantic bowl. The beef was extremely tender. I'm never really in the mood to eat Vietnamese outside of my home but I will say this place has yet to let me down. And it's great for late night eats!

P762UjauSPmM0ZRB2V4ePg.text: I don't think I've had pho like this in 15 years.  We were brought here by a few friends who come here almost on a weekly basis and sing the praises of the broth.  We had the small rare steak and a flank ph which were both incredible.  The rare steak had a complex, flavorful broth while the flank tasted like there's a wizard in the kitchen, letting magical soup simmer for hours with the right amount of stock, fat, and ingredients.    We also ordered the gi cun which was fantastic on its own, but complemented an already amazing post-bar dinner.  Highly recommended.

mCDNYgs_2ONw5kkWp0IiWg.text: Food is to die for!!! You can't get more authentic than this. It was so good, I came back the next day. If you love Vietnamese food, this is a must in Sin City.

AQOdPEmDbnh1ksawMvEyeg.text: Ordered the beef with shrimp hot pot. It was a lot of meat and veggies, good for 2 people. We have been to many kbbq but never to viet kbbq where u cook your own meat and then roll your own spring roll! Loved it, will be back again next time we come back to Vegas.

vBrWP5Qq4nJUMgeZINjacw.text: I came to have dinner with family and friends and the service was horrible.. we were greeted by one server then another took order then a different one brought the food. The server that brought food didn't even know the number or food we ordered. It seem they were bother when we asked for extra plates twice since they're 7 of us and they only brought us 6. After they brought us our food no one came to refill drinks we waited about an hour and still no one came until I asked for the check. A Hispanic server came and try to make excuses saying they were busy but they had about 6 tables in the whole restaurant, I let him know what the problem was and my son even ask for a manager and no one came.  We love the food but don't think we will be back they didn't seem to care about our business.....

4tkx4LyiQboXhSYRAOtTwQ.text: This is now my go to for Vietnamese food.   Food taste, portion and quality is excellent. Service is friendly and polite unlike most Asian restaurants. I went with nineteen friends and they took great care of us...at 4:30 am in the morning!

fo-63VterfswwiVfJc83WA.text: Service was great for a Vietnamese place! I'm impressed!  Banh xeo $10.95: it's super big, had shrimp, pork and mushrooms with onions and lots of bean sprouts inside. Edges were crispy but the center was still slightly doughy.  Bo Tai Chanh small $7.95: meat was too rare for my liking, too chewy. But the portion was decent.  Vermicilli with pork and eggrolls $10.95: husband loved it, eggrolls were big and crispy.  My brother got their Pho Dac Biet with an extra side of meatballs ($2.50)- tastes similar to any other pho places.   It's located a bit farther down spring mountain but because of the service we would definitely be back.

VzVwNQYdxVQC8WhEPsJ0Gg.text: I'm a long ways from mama's cooking but their bun bo hue is the closest to the real thing I have been able to find in Vegas thus far. Their banh canh and pho are pretty on point as well. Their bun rieu was bland, though. A little pricey but they at least have big portions! It's a spacious restaurant and clean. Service has been consistently good. All in all, pretty great viet spot!

gqibsuGUwG40_znIk955BQ.text: I will give this place a five star but my only complain is this guy with the glasses work late at night..What is wrong with him?? Im a regular but this guys always brings negative energy and bad vibes whenever we go there.He seems like always having abad day,no personality ,bad attitude and he drags when hes walking like he seems always not on d mood to work.I love this place!great food but I wish they will get rid of this guy.Everyone else is nice and  great service besides this guy with longer hair and glasses.If the owner reads my review trust me this guy will destroy ur business.

Nha9iYl-mHFxJTK7Adr4nA.text: We ordered banh hi, some bbq chicken w/ rice, bbq beef w/ rice. Overall the foods were good, they gave a whole small size chicken. The bbq beef with rice and banh hoi were yummy. Banh hoi is a big portion with noodle, beef and veggies. 3 peoples in my party can finish 2 orders of banh hoi and very full. The service was okay.

Obvm7ZAl46oM3Vrf2KRovw.text: It's so good! I had the brisket pho with egg rolls. The broth was amazing! The brisket was sooo tinder and the noodles were cooked to perfection.   My waiter was a 4 Star as it took 10min for us to get our check.   Still a great experience and I'll be back!

5ADhvXkLxg-A8h-NwNFFmw.text: This is my favorite  Vietnamese restaurant here in Vegas. There food is so amazing and there is plenty of choices on the menu but their service is almost insulting. I watch others being served and accommodated and then there is myself, the lone traveler. I ordered egg rolls and spring rolls as an appetizer and they got them out within 5 minutes of ordering. I ordered the oxtail pho and waited 35 minutes for my soup that was after waiving down a server.   I brought a group of five last night for dinner. Service again was horrible. They forgot food, food was not all served together so some had their plates while others waited up to 15 minutes after others being served.  The food is amazing and I give them 3 stars. I am so made I don't even want to eat my soup now.

niC_t5GNPGLHoxWtpJCoCg.text: Best Vietnamese restaurant in Vegas by far!!!! Clean food good taste!!! Everything was so nice and Authentic !!! I'm a Pho lover , Pho at Viet noodle bar very yummy , clear soup feel really authentic

WM-Tm4YZigOZHTd_ItcHXw.text: Generous portions of tender meat, tasty broth and fresh noodles at a reasonable price.  What mire could you want?  This is our go to Vietnamese pho restaurant whenever visiting Vegas. They also have rice dishes.

qKWW2HWiTnPnDpYvVuN2pw.text: We've been here about 5 times in the last 6 months.  We never had an issue, we would come more often if we wasn't out of the way for us.  Everyone here is friendly and helpful with the menu.  The cashier/manager is friendly too.  There's always parking here when we come in the evening and late night.  Usually not a wait when we come, I believe during busier time you would have to write down names on the clipboard when you walk in the front.  I love it's always been clean when we come here.  Service is quick.  The gentlemen tonight who checked us out was really nice and smiling, he asked us how was our food and if we had any issues.  That's nice, usually nowadays people don't even bother.  We've tried their:  Small Beef Salad (Citrusy with the lime and vinegar, nicely done, new for us and we're a fan) Egg Rolls (Not bad, we enjoyed it) Com Tam Charbroiled Short Rib (A MUST, I crave this from time to time here!) Com Bo Lua Luc (Good, husband and I preferred the Charbroiled Short Rib better) Pho Dac Biet (Decent, better than most places in LV) Bun Rieu (Everywhere makes this dish a little different, I liked it) Mi Wonton (Clean, light, hit the spot for late night)  Another positive thing is the vegetables are always fresh here.  We never had bad or ok condition.  Looking forward to come back to try a different rice dish. =)  Credit cards ok for over $15.  Vietnamese places are usually cash only back in California, so I'm used to this.

7fgbVgda6C5yZOoy31rdmA.text: I really enjoyed my visited to Viet Noodle bar. We came in on a Monday night around 11pm. They are open late and it was relatively quiet.  We ordered the Charbroiled Beef Spring Rolls, the beef combination pho and the Egg Noodle Stir-Fried with Seafood (Hu Tieu/Mi Xao Vi).  The food was fresh and we enjoyed the whole meal! The service was great too.  With tax, the total came to $26. We will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QOr--gZmgPI7n9vDjfWdFA.text: Excellent! Very good food with generous portions. I ordered something I never had and expected it to be flavorless because the broth was clear but it was one of the best things I ever ate! Great place! Highly recommend!!!

_ApEoAjl-CMld7g_WL1IWw.text: Large pho restaurant.  Feels like a pho factory!  And a good pho, this factory produces!  When eating pho, the most important criteria is the broth.  You want a clear broth: a murky broth indicates impurities.  Their broth was clear, clean and consistent.  And also packs a wallop of good flavor!  MSG?  Probably.. it's vietnamese.  Like Japanese ramen, MSG is a given...  Meat portions were HUGE!  Well, maybe not huge but plentiful!  LoL  Delish broth with generous meat portions.  No complaints here!  Wasn't the perfect pho eatery.   -  They were chang on the Veggie portions.   -  Condiment bottles were grimy!  Cmon, clean that sh*t up!  But overall, yummy pho!

EHS6jm1VzkqRtTK8mtoeDg.text: Came here for lunch yesterday with a party of 6. The restaurant is really big- lots of seating and outdoor parking. I ordered the combo pho and it was pretty good. My friend wanted to get the oxtail pho, however they ran out (minus one star).   Service was super slow even though there was not many people in the restaurant. It took us a while to flag the waiters down, order, get our bill, etc. Very disappointing because they took forever (minus one star).   Portions were okay sized, broth was flavorful. Great prices, but they really need to work on their service!

YL8fhWcqK5a2iHQMJjRahg.text: They say some good pho keeps the doctor away. My friends a weekly customer and raves about this place. I'm not super into Vietnamese food but their pho was pretty good. I tried both their mixed and filet pho. It arrived super fast. Their Thai tea and hot tea were so good though. The reason they didn't score higher with me was with the lack of service. Make sure you ask for everything up front because you're going to have a hard time getting the staff to stop for anything else you might need. I heard they also get super packed at dinner time. I went during lunch and it was much slower. All in all not a bad place.

xaQl7UWMFAGXdWGdOt0UhA.text: Service is attentive.  Place was squeaky clean.  Servers were friendly and seemed interested in our enjoyment of the meal.    The pho was flavorful and the noodles were very good.   It could have used a bit more beef brisket in the large bowl.  The chicken wings appetizer was well prepared and tasty.  We also ordered steamed rice with grill pork chop and grill shrimp.  The meats were both seasoned nicely and were tender.  We really enjoyed our meal.    The only really odd thing was the music.   They were playing post-grunge Rock and it was very out of place in a Vietnamese restaurant.  The volume was high enough that you could not ignore it.   I don't mind the music genre but it just was quite odd in this venue.     If you want a good bowl of pho in a clean place, this will do the job.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

x3G8F4HGNug5G0Dt2dwVVA.text: This was our first time visiting Viet Noodle Bar. Most of the customers in the restaurant seemed to be Vietnamese, which made us feel more confident in our restaurant choice!   Ambiance is shinied up mom and pop with a modern twist.   We ordered the beef salad and beef pho with everything in it. Everything was flavorful and fresh.  Might the best beef pho broth I've ever had. I was extra happy that the basil accompanying the pho was high quality (sometimes the leaves come out looking wilted and spotty).   Definitely looking forward to coming back to try more dishes on the menu. I'm especially interested in the desserts they keep in a refrigerated case near the cashier.

Odawt6lLzrBuRzUb4q1XXQ.text: Best pho spot in town and just having to be open until 6am in the morning makes it all the better. I come here a lot to where our server Aldere knows my order great service and great vibe it's a must try if your visiting from out of town or looking to check out a new PHO spot you won't be disappointed.

vmBQcDgF130RB3XanalcKg.text: The #53 Bo Nuong Vi/Nhung Dam aka "Beef BBQ or Vinegar Hotpot" for  $28.95 is delicious and plenty for 2 people. This item requires self cooking like KBBQ and can be a fun way to learn or show off your spring roll wrapping skills.  This comes with a plate filled with thin slices of raw beef marinated in garlic, a set of small spring roll wrappers, and a plate filled with various veggies including mints, basil, fermented radish/carrots, cucumbers, and bean sprouts. Two types of dipping sauce is provided: fish sauce, and some type of shrimp paste. The paste is a bit too thick and strong in flavor for me. I prefer to use fish sauce and add a heavy scoop of chili into it.   The Thai ice tea is pretty good, but can be on the sweet side.   The service was awesome. Servers were friendly and quick to help. We came on a Thursday night and the place was filled but did not have a wait.   The restaurant is located at the entrance of a plaza, and I never seem to have trouble parking. However there aren't many spots because it is shared with other businesses.   Will come back here in the future

NJ_TJ5ivmR2Fi84Tl2A_Ug.text: I was going to eat here but when the rude lady told me I couldn't park my work truck I thought otherwise   She said she was the owner of the parking lot and that i had to leave   Horrible way to treat someone that is working and just trying to get something to eat

93B2XSCzJEn8Pwl3QKP8rQ.text: Last month my girl and I ate here.  I dont know what happened this time around?  Food was great as usual, but we waited a while for the server to come around with everything.  Very very slow service!!!!

EqPmbknkZaCe-z-h5mnJsA.text: Today is Labor day.  I was craving a pho,but unfortunately most of restaurants are closed for national holiday.  So I decided to open yelp and checking which pho restaurants are open. And there you go,this restaurant open for today!yay When I entered with my sis,there was an one surver let us sit at booth table. Yay booth! Booth! Three servers was served our table and service was good good. The one thing I love here is, they use instant one time chopstickkk! Food was clean taste. I will Definitely coming back!

Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8mb8zlnti4258E2m_D5mmA.text: It was early. Well, more like 9:30am. But it's Vegas, so it's considered pretty early (as nights end at like 5am). There were quite a few tables occupied. We ordered the beef cubes (filet), pho, and another rice dish with beef and shrimp (grilled). The spring rolls with charboiled pork were so flavorful! We normally do fried spring rolls, but wanted to try the charboiled, and it was the right choice!  Pho was good - I've been craving pho and it hit the spot - they gave me a lot of meat. Couldn't finish it. The beef cubes were a bit on the salty side. Do not get the rice dish with choice of meat - they're literally just grilled. We didn't like that at all.  Iced coffee was amazing.

nw3DmZJ1WHOTxqsKsoSMiA.text: This place is poppin'! Is that what the cool kids say these days? Whatever, I said it! This place was pretty cool. Now I feel like an old nerd. Let's move on.  I'm always on the hunt for a good Pho place and luckily one of my best girlfriends is also a Pho addict, so we try to hit new spots all the time. We were in this area and I saw this place on Yelp! so off we went. It was midday on a Sunday and it was crowded AF. There was an actual wait list and a guy running back and forth, calling out names, clearing tables. I was like "Yeah! This is going to be good." Also, we were literally the only non Asians in the joint, so I knew we had found a good spot(I love you, Asians and all your delicious foods!)  After we were seated, the waitress took our drink order super quickly and came back with our beverages in a flash. I usually order water but that day I had a coke as well. I will say that the Coke here sucked. It was like totally the Coke that is running out of syrup and is more watered down. Not impressed,  but I'll give them a pass.  I ordered chicken Pho and my friend ordered vegetable Pho. We split the shrimp egg rolls. Shrimp egg rolls were good but they didn't clean the shrimp, so...shrimp poop. I can also look beyond that because the Pho was damn good. The broth was nice and light, plenty of noodles and chicken. They top it with the standard green onions and cilantro. All in all, quite enjoyable. Would definitely come back again.  I do have a funny note to add from when we paid our check(we usually split it). I finished signing and the waiter brought over my friend's check and he looked at me and said very sternly "Give her the pen!" I was like "whoa!" I have a pretty good sense of humor, so as soon as he was out of sight we busted up laughing. No sugarcoating, no pen stealing.   Looking forward to coming back and trying more items from their menu.

e2T5yngtO9YnnRTcNUkdFA.text: Best pho in town! Huge portions and reasonable prices! We enjoyed everything from fried rice, spring rolls to fresh coconut water! Service was great! Will return when I'm in town!

PtVjN7D5BV2pcFaq90lIxQ.text: Last week, we took a rest stop in Las Vegas but did not want a long lunch. We found Viet Noodle Bar from yelp.  There were lots of parking spaces. The temperature was warm outside. There are double entrances. I supposed they keep the hot air out on a hot day. The sitting area and atmosphere are awesome.  My pho was OK. The broth was bland. Service was good however the waiter got my drink order wrong. I wanted the Logan drink but I received the lotus dessert drink. In general, since this is in Las Vegas, the higher than normal menu prices are expected. Minus 2 stars. By the time we finished lunch, the outside temperature was going up to the high 90s. I would definitely come back after trying out the many new nearby Asian food places.

gdsuZM3jBtbnXAXP6dfL_A.text: I was craving Bun Bo Hue and Bun Rieu so I checked Yelp for some good places in Las Vegas. I called in two orders to go, it came out to be about $21.   I like how the parking lot isn't as congested as Pho Kim Longs lot. I also liked the atmosphere at this restaurant a lot better. They had a few booths and cute decorations. Also, it didn't seem as hectic.  My food stayed hot all the way home, even after my detour to Lees. I'm glad they wrapped the soup container in a bag because my container top had a small cut so a little bit of soup spilled out. No big deal.  5/5 for the bun bo hue! Not as good as the ones in Orange County, but I'm pretty sure it's one of the best ones in vegas!  broth was flavorful with a ton of meat. I think the only downside is that they didn't give enough noodles.  3/5 for the bun rieu. The broth wasn't as good because it was definitely lacking some tomatoes. The meat that they used was ground up pork and crab or something. I wasnt a huge fan of it. Also, the tofu was a bit hard. I did like how they put fried onion on the noodles.

hzsqrYs6gU8bMPegvakoGQ.text: First time here, took my parents and thoroughly enjoyed our dinner.  It was quite an experience.  We ordered the BBQ beef, shrimp and squid where you cooked it on a portable grill.

M0vDQ2tO9PmUokEwKoPAMA.text: I was SO excited to try Viet Noodle Bar. All of the good reviews and pictures had me jumping out of my seat waiting to try it! I was excited to see what all the hype was about. So we decided to try it out instead of our usual spot. When we got there it was a little busy which is no big deal, we don't mind a wait for really good food. So we waited about 5 minutes, and then the server told us there was a booth thats available. We started walking there and all of the sudden another server popped up right as we got there and said "No! This is for someone else" it was very loud and I mean i don't care about a booth anyways but do you need to be so loud about it?  Anyways we got seated at an awkward table meant for 4. Thats fine, we just wanted our pho! We got the calamari for an appetizer because I love calamari. I neveeeer pass it up. I also ordered the beef flank pho, and my boyfriend got the brisket pho.  The Calamari was OK, nothing special about it. Nice flavor, and I liked the dipping sauce.  Now, for the pho. We didnt get any toppings to add to the pho which kind of surprised us, we're used to bean sprouts, basil, lime, jalapeno....etc. But okay, we can live without it! The brisket pho my boyfriend got was great, he loved it. MY pho however....was a different story. It started off great, but I soon noticed all I had was FAT. Literally. All fat, no meat. I didnt order their fatty flank. I ordered FLANK. So it's very very disappointing to find a legit pile of fat in my pho. I included a picture of the fat i picked out for proof, and that wasn't all the fat. There was more in the bowl but it was so gross I couldn't finish the dish. The sad part too was that their portions are incredibly small! We're used to huge portions from other pho places. Honestly I was just sooo sad. On top of that it seems like our server forgot about us. We were left alone not being checked on, or asked of we were ready for a check for what seemed like FOREVER. There was a table behind us with a group of people that got there after us, ate their food, and ended up leaving BEFORE us. We were so annoyed we eventually tracked down another server who kindly helped us out and grabbed our check for us.  If the service was great and outstanding, we would have come back to give this place another shot. But the combo of disappointing food and bad service left us wanting to never come back here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ths pile of fat from my flank pho, not all of it might I add. More in the bowl. :(
Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Brisket pho
Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Calamari

wSWFX1U4N1XO1iVBhJzT7A.text: Viet noodle bar is a must try. The pork spring rolls were full of flavor and their stir fried filet mignon entree was great as well. I like their large menu selection and clean restaurant. Also open late hours

9MffmYnmHU7GDwjqEjP_xg.text: My go to pho place for breakfast, lunch, dinner, and second dinner! This place is great for late nights and is super spacious for big parties. Their whole menu is seriously delicious. I've tried a lot of different things on their menu and so far everything is amazing. The wait staff is very attentive and fast. I always recommend this place to anyone who asks for some delicious pho. They also have bun rieu which not a lot Vietnamese restaurants have so that's a plus in my book.

jAKCNWzVujqZJlB1d7USPg.text: I'm a vegan and their tofu is perfect in the vegetable pho. Huge portions. Customer service is ONE HUNDRED PERCENT! Absolutely great staff and manager.

c-twdGu6JC2E7Vyq82EjUg.text: I had a great time drinking 2 coronas.. The food was great and I'm a regular here .. After the descovery of a long thin hair and the waiter didn't communicate the issue to his manager .  The waiter and service really disappointed me..

bLrtFC6I1N3OSSdFsFt_3g.text: This is my all time favorite spot to eat pho! You will not be disappointed I always order the combination pho

ja2GiiKUFpaTXfwB6QUb5g.text: This place is open LATE.  The Bun Bo Hue is decent but other pho bowls not all that outstanding.

ZSUZzQfTPUaxzT073fXRnQ.text: Best Pho I've had in Vegas! The oxtail Pho had lots of meat and the broth was delicious! The staff worked well together and were very nice. The other items on the menu looked great.

OeRHJpWKdiVbhRf6kwxN_g.text: Definitely the best pho in town. Portions was perfect, reasonable price. The broth was sooo gud I ordered combo pho, shrimp pho add stake rare. Chicken fried rice yumm..... will come back when I visit the town again

gm0YCNUiyoFYH2PUv1rfig.text: Talk about big portion. On a rainy day I ordered a small special combo pho. The portion of this noodle was a lot ! I never expected to not finish my pho since I always finish my pho all the time. I would say the pho was very good and would come back again. The spring rolls was good too.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fjEyO0OHDutnrq9NDOCFqg.text: Really great service and the food comes out so fast. The pho is pretty good but the spring rolls had pork that was marinated it was a bit weird compared to the normal.

WrGVYFXul_aqGOcufvNTOg.text: Pho was really good.  Banh canh was good too.  I had banh xeo and they give  you a lot of veggies but  they need to put more meat in it.  Otherwise great food and we definitely will be back!

Lt-M9F_4hQbOlUyDFPM-eg.text: Only a few pho place that was open late. It was closeby, $15 cc minimum.  Got the Rib Eye Pho and Thai Iced Tea. Broth was ok, the rib-eye was horrible. How can they charge so much for such chewy meat.  Thai Iced was good for Vegas.  Nice roomy seating. Place is good for big group, quality could be better.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yucky Rib-Eyed Pho

QGZIp7izeSlBq8PQznc0Hg.text: It's hard to impress me when it comes to Viet food.  This place seemed to hold so much promise, but in the end, it was a yelp hype.  My friend was going to order pho, but since they put msg in a lot of their foods, he declined.  I don't care about msg, so I got the wonton egg noodle soup.  The dish was a touch salty, but otherwise, quite good.  Noodles were AL dent and wontons were flavorful.  7.5/10.  Husband got a MI xao with seafood.  I thought it was oddly sweet, but They did gave him a lot of Meats and veggies.  5/10.  My friend got the Lotus root salad , but even the nuoc mam was sugary. 6/10.  I've never seen this dish messed up.  Same thing with the peanut sauce for the goi cuon.  So I guess that was the running theme for the meal...which is funny, b/c viet food is not supposed to be sweet at all.  My aunties are always criticizing food based on how fatty or sweet it is.  Given that I never pay this much for viet food and how subpar the items I tried were, there's no need for me to return.

Z1lCIUqbrJwohgARLIQbdQ.text: A friend invited me to go there one evening. It was very busy. This is a good sign, I thought and I was right. My first test of every Vietnamese restaurant I visit is to order the pho tai noodle soup. I figure if they get that right, then I'll come back to try other things. So I ordered the soup and the fried egg rolls (cha gio). The egg rolls came first with a plate of fresh vegetables and pickled radish and carrots. Egg rolls were delicious, crisp and piping hot. Then came the soup. The pho tai was a large portion, with lots of sliced, tender beef and noodles in an amazingly flavorful broth.   Because of that first visit, I went back and tried the oxtail pho and my husband got the bun with grilled chicken and pork. It was also amazing. I will go there again and again. I highly recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail pho! Yummy.

8Fqx2ct5YeuIg64Exsc3lA.text: Greeted at the door and seated in a booth quickly.  Server was informative and polite.  Food arrived quick.  Pho soup tasted watered down. Wont order oxtail pho again.  Babe ordered popular blood cake soup. She enoyed it whereas I'd pass.   Will return to try other dishes.  Forgot to mention: SHRIMP ROLLS WERE DELICIOUS! MUST HAVE!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6i2xPaRCdUX_IKlkzFd1xg.text: This is one of my favorite pho places. Although I have not been to many, this is my go to! It's very clean and open once you walk in. The customer service is pretty good. They have TVs so you can watch sports while eating lunch with the family. The best thing though is the broth. I always get the rib eye pho. And wow! The broth is amazing. Another plus is the wait is never too long. I e always waited less than 10 minutes.

CdtMlMS5QkewOMz5Ka8mfw.text: I really heard great things about this place and really wanted to like it. As I walked in, I was met with wonderful smells and spices so I figured that was a great start already. We ordered the pho dac biet, vermicelli with egg roll and thit nuong, and wonton noodle soup. I thought the display of food was nicely organized, but overall I thought the taste was alright. The pho wasn't really exceptional and I didn't enjoy it as much as I would have liked. The vermicelli was okay too, the egg roll was very crispy and I thought nicely done. The thit nuong was more lemongrass flavored and not the same authentic taste that I'm used to having. The wonton soup was alright too. Overall the staff seemed friendly and food came out really quick.

e6eQ-AOUCecmiU8aF-G1Zw.text: I'm revisit this restaurant and I'm still impress with the taste and the cleanness of the restaurant . The only disappointment is you will leave this place with the smell of grilling beef ... I don't think this restaurant is equipped with bo Nuong Vi .... no smoking fans so all customers leave here with funny that bbq smell ... Many of my friends has the same opinion .... so 3 stars this time .

-G74Uf7Jksl6AyrUHaqGxQ.text: Went to this place based off yelp reviews great location a little ways off the strip tho.  When we arrived it took about five minutes to be greeted by the door. We waited patiently by a sign that says wait to be seated. Was seated shortly after.  Menu was brought shortly after.  I ordered a chicken pho my girl ordered a beef combo pho .  I feel like we waiting a bit long to receive our food almost 15 minutes. My girls pho tasted great but when it came to my soup my chicken tasted like it had been freezer burned and over cooked causing a very dry and unpleasing noodle soup.   Im sure this place has great food but I was unsatisfied with my experience.    The place looks clean and well kept.  I would probably give it another shot when im back In town at a later time.

Xv6HyUx9rmBvAWRKfZ6miQ.text: This is my favorite grill (nuong vi) in town!  They have alot of choices on the menu!  Gotta check this place out yourself because its the best in town so far for Vietnamese food!!!

V0IUafgbV-iy8w0eM2pyMQ.text: This place has good pho. The rare steak in the pho is super good, I wasn't as big of a fan of the brisquet in the pho. The bun bo hue was good and I loved the type of noodles in it. The blood cubes are definitely a personal preference of whether you will like them or not. This place has good service and they are quick with your order. There is a good atmosphere here and I will be coming back for sure.

Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisquet and rare steak pho
