69KCVfqjzNwP_w_VWNAnkg.text: This place exceeded my expectation. One of the best spicy beef noodle soup I've had. The rest of my friend's orders were pretty tasteful as well. We'll return here again.

O2rxkjb7ybGxnBnqxm0rfA.text: Firat time here came on a Tuesday at 7pm, place was quite busy, had to wait in line for 12 min.  They could use a bit of cleaning as there was dust on the fake plant and the ceiling of the entry, as well as on the light above my table, the booth I was sat in needed to be cleaned as there was dried food particles stuck on the wall, looks like some of it was hoisin sauce.  At least the floors were clean.  I startes with an order of Spring rolls with shrimp and pork, they were great, the fish sauce was a little on the strong side, could have uses some fresh lime and more water.  Next I ordered a large Pho rib eye noodle soup, good size bowl, chop sticks were individualy wrapes wooden disposable, they put a lot of rib eye in the soup, more than other places when you order extra meat.  The soup's broth seemed a little watered down, the server refilled my water as soon as it was low.   Service was good Food Quality was good a few minor changes would make it great. Food portion was generous Price was good gor the portions. Cleanliness was poor, needs minor work for dust grease build up...  Will be back again.

EMvjF3XmP_30-XBM0ALoew.text: Bigger isn't always better ... even in Vegas. This mammoth of a Banh xeo took half the table. However, it was a disappointment. Had a slight coconut flavor but lacked the proper amount of seasoned pork and shrimp. It also wasn't crispy like it should be. I ate up all the fresh veggies and half the bland crepe. The egg rolls were good as well as the flan. The oxtail soup was meh. Meat could have been more tender. Cute decor though. Didn't look like most C rated pho places with sticky chopsticks and roaches scurrying around my feet. Buuuutttt that's probably why the food tastes good so its a toss up --- good taste and poor health code standards or meh taste and no trip to urgent care.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banh xeo. Big but little in flavor.

bKLIZo-_5_5D4Ybo76wnMA.text: Another great option for Vietnamese food. I ordered their shrimp papaya salad along with their grilled pork & eggroll over vermicelli noodles. Very delicious and the perfect dish on a hot summer day in Vegas.

ldP3BwbMhQm8JFqG9WokGg.text: This establishment understands authentic Vietnamese dining while not sacrificing american dining traditions. Most Asian eateries will do it Asia style, I.e. puts down menus, but takes orders before you can even open the menu (let's be honest, Asian people know what they want when they eat out. No need for a menu) drops off food, never returns again...unless you raise your hand to let them know you need something. I understand this, and while also being an American born Asian, I've accepted the cultural difference! Not here. They're really good and also very sweet and prompt about checking back with you to make sure you're enjoying your food. I had to ask for a million different things last night and even I was annoyed with myself. Everyone there was more than happy to get me whatever I needed. Never once made me feel like I was asking for too much!!  As you can read, I'm already ecstatic! More importantly, dang the food was bomb!! I came for pho many times before. I finally decided to tap into my past and retry other Vietnamese cuisine that I have otherwise forgotten about. I tried, for the first time as an adult, Bo/tom nuong vi. My belly was giving me the hour long middle finger for not trying this sooner. For those of you reading this, it's a grill in front of you, self cooking of meat and shrimp, and then rolling yourself up some spring rolls! It's an experience and it's tasty! A lot of multitasking involved so bring someone who can do more than 1 thing at a time. I made this mistake and forcefully ended up with most of the responsibility. HAHA! We also tried the bun bo hue, a spicy noodle dish that I remember disliking as a child. I haven't had it in 19 years. They tossed meat in there like it was about to go out of style! Sooo much meat. I ain't mad about it! Twas tasty. I will say though, My heart still belongs to pho. That's the only Vietnamese noodle soup in my heart. Would I come back here?! Abso-PHO-king-lutely.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat dish before cooking.
Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bun bo hue

_Q3QHyU-U5xg_ZlOrhlFOA.text: Second time here and normally the service is very hospitable and quick with requests; today not so much. We asked for a different waiter and the new guy was more attentive to our needs (party of 6). We ordered plenty of food and the original waiter complained saying you should have asked for a bigger table if you wanted to order a lot of food...what?? Of course we want a lot of food, there is 6 of us eat and share. Service began as a 2-3 but ended with a 3-4.   We were seated within about 5 minutes though it was a very busy during Sunday lunch. After dealing with the aforementioned waiter (oh and not receiving two dishes we ordered), the new guy brought everything we asked for. We ordered waters and a couple Viet-coffee's, these were tasty iced coffees that the family shared.  We started with some spring rolls which came served with fish sauce and a second type of sauce, darker and had a distinct smell. The spring rolls were fresh and delicious 5/5. Next we ordered a couple marinated beef platters with shrimp. They brought out the grills and we cooked to our liking. The meat had good flavor and didn't have any fat, the shrimp was also marinated and was fresh 5/5. They brought out the veggie platter / fixings for our hand rolls and two trays of crisp wraps with warm water. It was interesting building your own wrap, including bean sprouts, noodles, lettuce, herbs and sauce. We also ordered some woven noodle which I wrapped around the fresh cooked meat and dipped in the fish sauce 5/5. Lastly we ordered a couple small ramen beef bowls (after the rolls was big enough to share) typical broth flavoring but the beef was good 4/5. Spiced it up a little with some Sriracha and hoi sen sauce.   Overall the meal was very good and the family had a good time. Only reason they received 4/5 is because of the original service. Will be back again, and now we know who not to ask for. Enjoy the pics

wJop5dEuX3K3XTGwvb7DXQ.text: I literally only went here instead of Pho Kim Long for the bun bo hue.   Food is great, service is okay but coming from San Gabriel Valley / Orange County, the prices were so high! I guess I should've expected it to be, since it is Vegas but still got a bit shocked seeing our bill.   Recommend it but be prepared for the cost.

_SURCO2To9Sml8xa1eru_Q.text: The server is AMAZING. They don't wear name tags so I didn't catch his name but he's tall, skinny, and bald. He was so nice and attentive and explained some menu items to us. My boyfriend and I came here because Pho Saigon 8 was "closing early", which we weren't impressed with. I'm sure glad they were though, otherwise we would have missed out on this place! The broth was the best we'd had in ages and the tendon and rare steak was DELICIOUS.

iU-2Ak1sA2rQQ2cPruc_4A.text: "I just want to begin by saying to Roosevelt E. Roosevelt, what it is, what it shall be, what it was..." - Adrian Cronauer  Viet Noodle Bar is an all-around good choice for Vietnamese food in Vegas, but there are dishes here that I absolutely love!   The Banh Xeo (Vietnamese Crepe) was the first dish to catch my attention at VNB. The dish isn't overly complicated, but super tasty. The crepe is cooked with onions, shrimp, and pork and folded over in half. There is a jungle of veg accompanying the crepe that includes a stuffing of bean sprouts, a side of pickled carrot & radish, some lettuce leafs, Tia To (Perilla), La Qu (Thai Basil), and fresh sliced cucumber. You decide how much herbs and veggies to wrap-up with some of the crepe in a leaf of lettuce, then dip it into the sweet fish sauce and enjoy.  I've enjoyed all the Phos and soups that I've had at VNB, but I return to the Chicken Pho more than others. I like to limit the amount of red meat I eat so I'm not usually opting for traditional Pho, but it is excellent here as well, as is the Ox Tail Pho. Chicken is typically more hit and miss at Vietnamese spots though--often an afterthought lacking flavor or loaded with msg. While certainly not eliminating the msg, VNB does a great job of not relying on it for the main source of flavoring and are still able to develop a substantially flavorful broth in their Chicken Pho.  One of my least favorite things about Viet Noodle Bar is the popularity of the on-table BBQ grills. It seems to be a good value for the amount of meat you are supplied with...probably why they are popular...but the result is a restaurant that often reeks of grilled meat. This is not always the smell you want to be wearing for the remainder of your day...so dine with caution. I haven't even ordered any of the grilled entrees, but swear that at least half the time I've carried this smell with me until freed by a shower.   I shared an order of the Bo luc lc (Shaken Beef) with a large group one time and found it be quite good...but again, not something that I partake in all that often.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Pho with a blob of chili paste
Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Traditional Spring Roll--shrimp and pork
Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Charbroiled Chicken Spring Roll

YvpinHSeYog4QHOPSMRPJw.text: Dinner last night after the RiSE festival. There were a lot of people eating at the restaurant despite it being midnight.  Our waiter brought waters and took our orders quickly. Only complaint was our food took quite some time to come out. There was about 10 of us and 2 of us got food at a time. If you weren't the one to wait, everyone ate a different times. Restaurants tend to time their food so that everyone got it together.   Pho Ap Chao - This was what I got and it was pretty good. There was a lot of veggies and meat on top of the noodles. Noodles were incredibly crispy which I liked.   Banh Xeo - My husband got this and it was not bad. The flavor of the batter was solid. It was a bit soggy though and we prefer if these were crisp and fresh off the pan.   I would say this is a decent Vietnamese restaurant but nothing ever beats a home cooked Vietnamese meal from mom's. If we were in the area and nothing else was open, we could come back. Otherwise, not the first place we would seek out.

ZQir4chrrCAetbJi4-IlIQ.text: The first time I came here with a party of three, it was not busy at all. We sat down right away but it took 20 mins for someone to come and take our order. The food was ok. Pho was good, even though they mixed up the order. The chicken wings had too much sauce on them. We also ordered shrimp fried rice and it was unimpressive. My second time attempting to give this place another try (because it had come highly recommended) was absolutely HORRIBLE! Just a party of two, when we arrived there were people already in the waiting area, obviously busier on a Sunday. I put my name down behind three other parties. The host comes and immediately seats a party that arrived AFTER us and the three other parties ahead of us WITHOUT even looking at the check-in sheet. Everyone waiting looked at each other and one couple just rolled their eyes and walked out. When the host returns and crosses out two names ahead of me, that were obviously still standing waiting. I try to explain that other people were here before the ones he just sat and he completely ignores me! Does not even look at me and just turns his back and says "yea, yea, yea!" We walked out obviously. Absolutely disgusting service. I would never go back, I don't care if they were giving food away for free.

-OL89Rab3M-dMMFfQPzeDA.text: Took the kids for Pho for the New Year.  It was ok.  Busy!   So maybe the service wasn't on point.   Server took our order,  messed up our drinks...Pho came out before the appetizers...  could have been an off day.  Waited 30 minutes to get seated, waited 20 minutes for the bill.  Ended up asking a random Employee for the bill. Didn't get our waters  replenished, no one asked if we needed anything... soo 4 stars is generous...

LEwbu5n70u63aKqu8tWsbg.text: This place is SO good! I was coming down with a cold and had just finished a long shift at work. I was in need of a nice hot brothy soup but figured that with it being so late (1am) I was out of luck. I friend of mine suggested Vietnoodle and I'm so glad he did. The service was fast and friendly but the Pho was the real star. The meat was great and broth was perfect. I will definently be back soon.

q6UGMzmVeCUg22Rm1DO-Ow.text: The pho is good but it's lacking in the meat. The meat has like a weird slime coating to it every time I eat there. Makes it feel weird.

4C-G2N_boqbCuivv9u6t5g.text: I was needing a morning Pho fix. I selected this place because of their published hours and proximity to the hotel. They open early (at 9:00 AM) which is good if your body is locked in on an Eastern time zone. And, it is approximately a 10 minute Uber drive from the center of the strip (Venetian).  I ordered my "go to" Pho, Pho Tai Sach. I thought it was just okay. The broth lacked much depth and needed a lot of doctoring with the hoisin (brown) and Sriracha (red) sauces. Also ordered a Cafe Su Da., and it was premixed. They didn't ask, but I prefer the individual brewing device/method.

6wsy8sGI1-AWPWPOHEe22g.text: completely disappointed- Service was horrible- Signed read wait to be seated and not one person who was working there greeted us -they were not busy, finally the waiter pointed to a table -threw menus on the table without one word( no hi, hello, absolutely nothing)-appetizers and starters came last ( totally forgot our spring order ) had to flag another server to ask about it- as for the food- at best edible -Pork chop& short rib - marinated too long like it was several days old so meat tasted on the mushy side from being in the marinade too long( although had decent flavor), Bum bo hue-soup was spicy flavored lemon water and over cooked meat, chicken wings - weird bbq flavor,  too bbq for "Asian" wings, Pho was alright- but came out warm, even my 11 yr old said it wasn't hot like what you expect with pho.

eDFWo4RW6weUeeUpijOmcg.text: It's late, and you're craving something light and warm. That boils down to ramen or pho. Well - you can guess where this is going..  Viet Noodle Bar is a spacious restaurant with a hefty menu of options. From noodles, to pho, to rice dishes - they got you covered! Oh, and the atmosphere of 90s music makes it pretty darn good as well.   The quality of the food is great, and the service is pretty friendly as well. I'd definitely recommend bringing you and the fam to eat some good food after a long day. Oh, and the parking area is pretty good too!

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

30F0vyOF6k-CGYVN4ZVstQ.text: We both looked at each other and decided "this place is okay." Food was out quickly just as it is in any noodle house.  There were many options in the menu. Service wasn't especially good or especially bad. No real 'wow' factor. The prices were reasonable and portions large. If there weren't so many options in the area, we would return but doubtful we'll come back. Recommended for udon or pho beginners.

VEK6_k7yJo3cWf_VhW64BA.text: The food was pretty bland and the service was kind of slow. Overall, I was truly excited to try this place but I'm probably going to keep looking for another pho place with more flavor.

8F9kZyDg55TK5RXBDgBUwQ.text: I am not a fan of Pho, but I took a bite into my friends Ox bone and it was good and generous (bowls are family size). Service was timely. Parking was ample. I had only coconut water, but ended up helping my friends finish their spring rolls (were good) and the lettuce and chicken plate, forgot the name, but it was also good. Definitely an authentic Vietnamese restaurant.

AN3U2bdHUrwYOaknsn8XCQ.text: YUMMMY!!! The best Bun I have ever had. Chicken was marinated perfectly. The pho was flavorful like they had been brewing the broth from the bones for days. The portions are huge. I def didn't think it was going to be so much food for the pricing on the menu. The guys who work there are very nice too.   They are open late so it makes the best late night spot ever. For sure will be back next time we are in Vegas!

UYsnfT4RRkw1usmFx9OvAg.text: Amazing place. It doesn't look like much on the outside, but I'm so glad we found the place on Yelp. The restaurant is very spacious inside with tons of seating, both booths and long tables. Boyfriend and I both got the ribeye pho and it was probably the best pho we've ever had. Delicious and had so. much. ribeye for $11.95. Extra noodles are just $1.75, extremely reasonable. Servers were also friendly and attentive. This will be our go-to pho place next time we're in Vegas!

vic9-r92xBQmalpdbkSaIg.text: This place feels like home! It makes me so excited to find a Vietnamese restaurant that is so comforting when it comes to the atmosphere and food. It reminds me of being back in the Bay Area and the food is delicious! So far, I've been here twice and I ordered Hu Tieu (Dry with seafood) and Pho. Omg, the Hu Tieu was amazing! Probably the best one I've tried so far in Vegas. The seafood one comes with soup on the side and I believe it's fish chunks in the broth. My hubby ordered a large with BBQ pork and the broth was just simply satisfying. They loaded their bowls with lots of meat! Very.. veeeerrry generous! Usually, some places give you 1-2 shrimps but I got like 4-5 pieces. The pho was perfect! I seriously didn't need to add any hoisin sauce or lime. It was just so good by itself. Instead of drenching my soup with Sriracha and all the other seasonings is they have on the table, I just dipped my meats with it in every bite. The workers are so nice too. They come by and check up on you. Love it! The shrimp egg rolls are great too by the way. I am definitely going here more often. So many good things on the menu to still try! This place is known for their oxtail pho. So everyone who lives here or visiting, that's what the #1 recommendation is. I'll update my post when I try something new! Cheers & happy eating!

Hi55BegZ_HhBROqBcxWZvA.text: During my week in Vegas, I had an immense craving for pho, so I stopped by Viet Noodle Bar. This was on par with most of the pho spots I frequent in Orange County. The broth was fragrant, the noodles and chicken were plentiful and the garnish was fresh and crisp. Prices were fair and they are open late, until 6 am!

HWLSWgC3Gv3kvJQcPPicmw.text: So many Vietnamese restaurants to choose from when I want to have some Vietnamese goodness in LV. So glad this one popped up when I was looking. Been opened a few years, restaurant is clean and spacious. Good service with a good sense of humor. Let's eat. Food were all flavorful and basically good. We will be back here when we need some VN food.

4p1G7EWHeo3E9MD4F-bzjg.text: Oxtail pho ribeye pho and shrimp egg rolls is what my boyfriend and I had. It was DELICIOUS! He said it's better than mine. LOL!! Great customer service. Price is good! Bowl was too big for me to finish. Definitely curl my hangover lol. Will definitely visit again in the future.

5DoGXiuFCiRmWfZbsS3Q6Q.text: This place damn suck for customer services you loss a customer your guy should learn how to serve the service.du ma Dan di Chay ban ma tuong Minh la back si thu khong co hoc ma tuong Minh hoc day hieu rong

fr17uVKtbuLfhF_Ei1xSSA.text: My first time here was actually a few weeks ago with my cousin. The service sucked, & it took them about 30 minutes to bring out our pho. After they brought out our food, they never came back to check up on us. The pho was delicious, btw, which is why I came back with my husband and kids just this past weekend.   I was craving for pho & my husband wanted bun bo hue. The place was packed when we arrived, & it took them about ten minutes to seat us. Our daughter ordered the rice plate with chicken, I ordered the pho dac biet (combination pho), & hubsters ordered bun bo hue. We also ordered an order of the spring rolls which was delicious! The pho took about 10 minutes to get to our table, my daughter's food took about 15-20 minutes, & my husband's food took about 30-40 minutes to finally come out. He was pissed... But that didn't stop him from enjoying his bun bo hue. Everything was delicious which is why I decided to give this place 3/5 stars. Their service still sucked, & I was hoping that it wasn't a repeat of my first visit; however, they did end up refilling our waters more than once so I guess there's that.   Would I be coming back? Ummm... Probably, most likely. But it wouldn't be my first choice to cure my pho fix.

RRctbS-doug1BK17FoVxHQ.text: Great quick service! Family friendly!  Food was DELICIOUS!! And not pricy!! Definitely will eat here again. The menu has some pictures attached to it to help you along the way! Our waiter Khoa was Amazing from the time we were seated! He gave us great recommendations!

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetarian roll, Thia iced tea and Shrimp Pho

3UB9G9QK7gEgl_uCudN0kQ.text: It is the broth that makes this pho the best. The broth is tasty, flavorable and not salty or oily. The vegetables are fresh and the beef was so soft and smooth. The nooxles were good too.   My husband had the charbroiled pork with rice and the pork was soft and full of flavor. My cousins had tbe udon and wonton and they both loved their dish.  I don't give five stars very often but the service was excellent. My water glass never went empty. The servers were fast  efficient and nice.   Amazing considering we ate at midnight on a Tuesday evening after taking a daylong trip to Page, Arizona. We will definitely be back again.

s7aoA1azfUhbN5abYMf94w.text: Hands down the best pho I've ever had. The truth is I personally didn't order it, I tried the pho that my friend had and I honestly wanted to steal his whole bowl it was that good( He might have stopped me by giving the evil eye, but that's okay. I can't blame him. ) You know when you have pho and you know there are spices in it, but your not exactly sure what they are, because they just didn't put enough in? Well forget about that at this place. You will taste the spices,you'll probably wonder how much they put in and why other places don't do the same, but believe me when I say this: The pho is amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wNQI424jrt6CIeYmyAbWLA.text: Nice and spacious restaurant with delicious Vietnamese food. I love the Bun Bo Hue and Pho here. Very authentic and easy to eat. The Bun Bo Hue has stronger taste so it's not for everybody if you are not used to Vietnamese cuisine though.  Get ready to smell what you eat since the food smell tends to cling on your clothings when you dine inside.

DGsz3hOGHOoOOCdnRhVW-Q.text: I've been coming here since they opened and it's my favorite pho place in Las Vegas.. I recommend literally everyone that comes into my job asking for a good Vietnamese place to eat at and i convinced all my non-asian friends to come here as well.. let's just say that this place is the best you're going to find if you want authentic delicious Vietnamese cuisine! I'm a REALLY REALLY picky person when it comes to my culture food and this place hasn't let me down..   ***BUT the only complaint i have is that they changed their bowl sizes recently which completely SUCKS because all your broth overflows the bowl and makes a huge mess!! I can't even mix it comfortably without everything falling out which is super annoying!***  I'm not going to list everything i've tried because i'll be here for an hour typing but let's just start off with some of my favorites... Pho ap chao, Combination pho, all their broken rice dishes, and Banh Xeo! They pretty much have a big ranged menu that will probably satisfy any of your cravings..    This place gradually got more popular and busier but the service is still amazing, very attentive and caring workers who makes it feel like home! I love the environment here! Huge portion sizes and flavorful food.. ever since i moved out i hadn't been able to eat a lot of my mom vietnamese cooking so this place is where i go to get my fixings! :)

ubc-t7-yg-l9diHeCETt4g.text: I got bo kho with rice noodle. It didn't taste like bo kho more like beef stew pho.  My boyfriend didn't care for the bun bo hue. The spring roll and egg roll were good. The Thai tea taste like milk. It had more milk then Thai tea. I should have known not to get Thai tea at a Vietnamese restaurant. This place is okay. I wouldn't be going back for sure but the hours are convenient. The atmosphere and costumer services is good.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 35. Bun Bo Hue
Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. No 28. Mi Bo Kho

_0Zg1uyBKuzM8T58YlhM5g.text: This is my go-to whenever I'm craving Vietnamese food or if it's late at night. They close at 6am which is super convenient.   I try to always get a different food item whenever I come back. I highly recommend the pho tai bo vien (rare steak and meatballs), bun rieu, or their BBQ specialty platter (Bo Nuong Vi). It feeds around 3-4 people and it's such an amazing social experience. Many of my friends do not know how to roll their own spring rolls whenever we get the BBQ so I spend a lot of my time rolling their springs rolls instead of eating...but man, the meat and all the veggies with it is superb. Really reminds me of home.

bARMQ27a2OmQQw0cVs64tw.text: Always delicious, great service. Traditional dining times are crowded and parking can be full. Best Pho in the area that I've found, broth is amazing.  My entire family's go to.

rlU84vs8c4tXOhxgR1OMCA.text: Ordered Bun Bo Hue to-go and I know it's not the same as eating it fresh from the kitchen at the restaurant, but let me tell you... it sure tasted great! I was able to make two servings with what they gave me. It was a lot, I loved it! So much meat and the broth was so flavorful! I've had bun bo hue from other places here in Vegas and by far this place was the best and it was to-go. Would definitely recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bun bo hue (take out)

dtS2uof4eJaRAS8Mm-pNRQ.text: Came here after a night of bowling. We were in the mood for Pho so we found this place and decided to try it out. We shared a large beef pho bowl which was very satisfying for two people. We also shared the egg rolls. The broth was average, nothing to rave about. The meat selection was good and the meat came very tender in the soup. It was the highlight of the dish. The egg rolls were good as well, but nothing I haven't had at a Vietnamese restaurant. I gave it a 3 for various reasons. Broth was average, table service was subpar, and overall it wasn't something I would need to tell a friend about.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet Noodle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg rolls

paEvwLxTJhHQRFYQ1UdeIw.text: So far I really like this place. The other day I went over there and got The vegetarian spring rolls. The total came out warm and on point and the peanut sauce was pretty damn good.  It looks like their vegetarian friendly menu portion is pretty good. I really wish they had a vegetarian or vegan pho that would make my day.  Parking was pretty easy and the decoration or design of the restaurant is actually pretty trendy unlike a lot of other Vietnamese places. The prices were actually pretty good too I thought it would be a little more expensive. I will definitely  eat here again and so far I think they deserve five out of five stars.

prgBBMOrZpNqimdEIPamOQ.text: This is my go to pho restaurant. I've been coming here since it first opened. Recently, the service has been great. The service is quick and the food tastes delicious as always. You can never go wrong with a large bowl of pho with some flank, brisket, bean sprouts, sriracha, and lime. The broth is flavorful and rich. I also love the spring rolls and egg rolls. The egg rolls are extremely crispy on the outside.   I've never had an experience here where the flavor of the food failed me! Highly recommend!!

JQJIxKwLSeFqrP_QSeTYag.text: Had the stir fry filet mignon (13.95) and small bowl of shrimp pho (9.95). Tremendous broth in the pho, generous portions and great garlic seasoning and cilantro on the steak. Definitely coming back. So rare to find a restaurant in this city anymore that is both delicious and you don't feel is ripping the consumer off with crazy high prices.

8-HQgtEJw1p5iepavZElag.text: This is a MUST on your to go list! The waiters are so helpful and so cheery and even adorable. As soon as my girlfriend sipped her last bit of water, one of the waiters popped out of nowhere and asked if she wanted more water, lol. The prices are great for the quantity you'll be getting. Everything is great, even right now during the rainy weather of Las Vegas. We've made this restaurant our top 3 to always go to because we won't leave disappointed, maybe we'll be disappointed when we are full and can't possibly eat anymore only to be hungry an hour after leaving   Best pho and hot pot place on our list!

S_EwoV-f62E5fBV-uFR-Vw.text: Took a friend out for her birthday lunch yesterday.  She loves Vietnamese food and want to try different dishes.  We ordered spring rolls, banh xeo, beef salad and special fried rice and pork chop.  Overall the food was ok and the service was Bette than the last time we can.  My friend enjoyed the dishes.

bWFxvdqSltyvQbvaEOx2Cg.text: When you are from out of town and you heard that Vegas has the BEST food... don't consider Viet Noodle Bar. The menu sounds great with a lot of traditional Vietnamese dishes but I was so disappointed in the meats that I regretted recommending this place to my friends (not the best impression).   We had the nem nuong (marinated pork sausage), bo la lot (beef wrapped in leaves) and banh xeo (crispy Vietnamese crepe). The Banh Xeo was good. It was crispy and had all the traditional ingredients, including mung bean that some places to don't always provide. We should've gotten two of these and concluded our dinner. Then came the meat. We were told that it takes them awhile to cook the meat. With that disclosure, I was excited. As it came out, it was cold and so dry that it crumbled to the cut. The lack of moisture disguised the flavor. The flavor was not as sweet or salty. In fact, it reminded me of cooking lean ground beef from the package and mistakenly left it too long. Tried to mask as much as we could with the fish sauce and pineapple shrimp sauce (no pineapple chunks, I guess they just utilize the juice?)  Genuinely wish this place would live up to the impression that the menu and Vegas gives. I suggest to skip this one and look at other options.

XU0hQKSPJDAcqhR_kfWNow.text: This place not too far from vegas strip. You can easily take a Uber or taxi. Restaurant big open space easily accommodate a big family or group.   Food menu had pictures that is always a plus. Helps out when you don't know the name of a Asian dish.  This is like comfort to me. Everyone enjoyed their noodles soup bowl. The soups were flavorful. The bowl may look small but the dept of the bowl can hold more then what I can eat. Portions were larger then your eyes.

AmFiBF3fkvStVulC979PCA.text: Wow, just wow. I ventured out for pho because I've been under the weather and it's been freezing here! I yelped this place and decided to give it a shot. I ordered shrimp pho and calamari. The calamari were just the rings, but were tasty, although my preference are the ones that have tentacles mixed in too. But, I digress. The pho came out and it was piping hot. I knew it would be good because the broth was free of any oily film, which happens a lot with pho. The soup was AMAZING. Shrimp cooked perfectly, brother flavorful and light, noodles and all other parts of the soup delicious! I will definitely be back!

xhcWTsWSD1iYwfOape1OBw.text: It was my first time here and I had a really good experience. I didn't have to wait to be seated. The server took our orders once we were ready. The food came quick! I ordered the oxtail pho, which comes in one size. It was delicious! Would definitely get it again! I would come back when I'm in town.

zCwuME7dbgDwOFkzw8qFGw.text: Prior to coming here I have extensive experience with pho. However once again I am impressed not only with the food but frankly the best Pho service in town. jojE1s3WQfyL9TZSLpbzHg.text: I always order Number 37 on the menu even though it says its a noodle bar their other items on the Menu are all tasty as well which surprised me. I go here frequently with my friends because its always open so late and tastes much better than most Vietnamese places I've been to. The staff here is also very friendly and accommodating because it was our friends birthday and they let us bring his cake to the restaurant and let him blow the candles. I definitely recommend going here if you're looking to eat Vietnamese food.

LyIu8EJ0RZStDj2a9dhtyw.text: It was a cold and rainy day in Vegas so what perfect food than PHO! Well I had a Bun Bo Hue but still. Spicy warm broth! Heals the soul.  Ok I apologize that this review is long over due!  This place is fast and gets busy quick.. Like you order and your food is out in 5 mins literally how it feels and it's HOT, steamy!  Not Luke warm stuff....   Prices is average but anything compared to Hawaii is cheap!  Payment by card is minimum of $15.

2M8BPLNSv2mJorZoEb9nVg.text: Delish! Great pho and noodles. Stopped by to grab a quick lunch on our road trip and worth it!

eVY-wBCcpPJmYf0Zn490rQ.text: THERE WAS A TOOTH IN OUR SPRING ROLLS.   I am not being dramatic or stupid. We have has food with bones in it before. This was not a bone.   We ordered oxtail pho and spring rolls, as my friend bites into his piece he thinks he chips his tooth, spitting the piece out he realizes it is not his.   We immediately call for a server, tell him about it and he takes it away immediately and says we'll replace it. We say no can we have the plate back so that would could get clearer photos and evidence of what it was. He said okay but never returns. We then ask for a manager and nothing. We then ask another server for the manager and he brings him  THIS IS WHEN WE GOT MAD   the manager then proceeds to rip apart the spring roll and say "this is pork it has bones" i then say ive had food and pork  with bones before. That is not a bone. He then asks me "YOU KNOW WHAT A TOOTH TASTE LIKE??" I say "no but i know one when i see one he says "I DONT KNOW WHAT TO TELL YOU MY TEETH ARE RIGHT HERE" the unprofessionalism of this manager is out of this world. No we did not want a replacement. We will never eat here again. But the way they handled it like it had happened before.   I dont know what kind of tooth that was. Maybe a baby pigs or idk but it was def a tooth.   DO NOT eat here again.
